Gen. Aelurillus Simon, 1884 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02796] Detail
type Araneus v-insignitus Clerck, 1757; gender masculine
N.B.: replacement name for Dia C. L. Koch, 1850: 64 (preoccupied in Coleoptera by Déjean, 1835), replaced by Aelurops Thorell, 1869: 37 (preoccupied in Mammalia by Wagner, 1830) and replaced by Ictidops Fickert, 1876: 68, 75 (preoccupied in Mammalia by Leidy, 1868); considered a senior synonym of Hemsennatus Roewer, 1955a: 778, type H. iranus Roewer, 1955 by Prószyński, 1966: 464 and of Melioranus Tyschchenko, 1965: 702, type M. lutosus Tyschchenko, 1965 by Prószyński, 1979: 303; Wunderlich, 1987a: 275, followed Harm, 1977 in considering this genus a junior synonym of Phlegra Simon, 1876 but other authors disagree.
Transferred to other genera:
Aelurillus apertus Denis, 1958 -- see Langona
Aelurillus constrictus (Karsch, 1880) -- see Nannenus
Aelurillus dimorphus Dönitz & Strand, 1906 -- see Phintelloides
Aelurillus festivus (C. L. Koch, 1834) -- see Asianellus
Aelurillus gilvus (Simon, 1868) -- see Asianellus
Aelurillus guttiger Simon, 1901 -- see Stenaelurillus
Aelurillus jocquei Azarkina, Wesolowska & Russell-Smith, 2011 -- see Manzuma
Aelurillus lymphus Próchniewicz & Heciak, 1994 -- see Manzuma
Aelurillus mallezi Denis, 1947 -- see Langona
Aelurillus nigritibiis (Caporiacco, 1941) -- see Rafalus
Aelurillus pichoni (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Asianellus
Aelurillus potanini (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Asianellus
Aelurillus pupus (Karsch, 1879) -- see Phintella
Aelurillus ranunculus (Thorell, 1875) -- see Yllenus
Aelurillus reconditus Wesolowska & van Harten, 1994 -- see Manzuma
Aelurillus sahariensis Berland & Millot, 1941 -- see Stenaelurillus
Aelurillus stanislawi (Prószyński, 1999) -- see Rafalus
Aelurillus tartaricus (Charitonov, 1946) -- see Langona
Aelurillus tristis Denis, 1957 -- see Pseudeuophrys
Aelurillus variegatus (Kroneberg, 1875) -- see Rafalus
Aelurillus wittmeri Prószyński, 1978 -- see Rafalus
In synonymy:
Aelurillus affinis (Lucas, 1846) = Aelurillus luctuosus (Lucas, 1846) (Azarkina & Logunov, 2006: 238).
Aelurillus azerbajdzanicus Dunin, 1984 = Aelurillus concolor Kulczyński, 1901 (Azarkina, 2003: 103, sub A. muganicus).
Aelurillus cervinus (Thorell, 1875) = Aelurillus plumipes (Thorell, 1875) (Azarkina & Logunov, 2006: 245).
Aelurillus cumbrecitanus Schmidt, 1982 = Aelurillus lucasi Roewer, 1951 (Wunderlich, 1992a: 521, sub Phlegra).
Aelurillus fuerteventurae Schmidt, 1976 = Aelurillus lucasi Roewer, 1951 (Wunderlich, 1987a: 275, sub Phlegra).
Aelurillus iranus (Roewer, 1955) = Aelurillus concolor Kulczyński, 1901 (Nenilin, 1984b: 1175).
Aelurillus mayeti Simon, 1885 = Aelurillus plumipes (Thorell, 1875) (Azarkina & Logunov, 2006: 245).
Aelurillus muganicus Dunin, 1984 = Aelurillus concolor Kulczyński, 1901 (Azarkina & Mirshamsi, 2014: 83).
Aelurillus ogieri (Simon, 1868) = Aelurillus luctuosus (Lucas, 1846) (Azarkina & Logunov, 2006: 238).
Aelurillus pallidemaculatus Denis, 1937 = Aelurillus luctuosus (Lucas, 1846) (Azarkina & Logunov, 2006: 239).
Aelurillus restingae Schmidt, 1977 = Aelurillus lucasi Roewer, 1951 (Wunderlich, 1987a: 275, sub Phlegra).
Aelurillus rubiginosopunctatus Schmidt, 1980 = Aelurillus lucasi Roewer, 1951 (Wunderlich, 1987a: 275, sub Phlegra).
Aelurillus sinaicus Prószyński, 2000 = Aelurillus conveniens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) (Azarkina & Logunov, 2006: 237).
Aelurillus steliosi Dobroruka, 2002 = Aelurillus leipoldae (Metzner, 1999) (Azarkina & Komnenov, 2015: 118, contra Bosmans et al., 2013: 9).
Nomina dubia:
Aelurillus approximans (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872a: 338, m, Israel, originally in Salticus, T to Aelurops by Simon, 1876a: 139, here by Reimoser, 1919: 111) -- Prószyński, 2003: 36.
Aelurillus candidus (Simon, 1868b: 70, f, Spain, Syria, originally in Attus, with Attus albicans Simon, 1871: 153 an unnecessary replacement name, T to Aelurops by Simon, 1876a: 139, here by Reimoser, 1919: 111) -- Prószyński, 2003: 37.
Aelurillus deruptus (Karsch, 1880c: 398, f, Philippines, originally in Ictidops) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1532, Prószyn'ski, 2009b: 161.
Aelurillus gesticulator (Lucas, 1846: 150, pl. 6, f. 9, f, Algeria, originally in Salticus) -- Azarkina & Logunov, 2006: 247, (but see Denis, 1937b: 1056, pl. 5, f. 11).
Aelurillus simoni (Lebert, 1877: 310, pl. 6, f. 45-47, mf, Switzerland, originally in Aelurops); Reimoser, 1919: 112 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:032208] -- Breitling et al., 2015: 66.
Nomen nudum:
Aelurillus iciformis (Franganillo, 1925) -- Franganillo, 1925: 32, as Aeulurops [sic] i..

Gen. Afraflacilla Berland & Millot, 1941 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02797] Detail
type Afraflacilla bamakoi Berland & Millot, 1941
N.B.: removed from the synonymy of Pseudicius Simon, 1885 by Żabka, 1993: 280 and several species transferred addionally from Pseudicius by Prószyński, 2017b: 43, contra Wanless, 1984c: 76 and Clark, 1974: 22; earlier considered a senior synonym of Flacilloides Denis, 1954a: 319, type F. antineae Denis, 1954 by Denis, 1955b: 120.
Transferred to other genera:
Afraflacilla courti Żabka, 1993 -- see Psenuc
Afraflacilla milledgei Żabka & Gray, 2002 -- see Psenuc
In synonymy:
Afraflacilla punctatus (Denis, 1947) = Afraflacilla tamaricis (Simon, 1885) (Prószyński, 1989a: 54, sub Pseudicius).
Afraflacilla samoaensis (Prószyński, 1992) = Afraflacilla kraussi (Marples, 1964) (Berry, Beatty & Prószyński, 1998: 165, sub Pseudicius).
Afraflacilla tripunctatus (Prószyński, 1989) = Afraflacilla braunsi (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Wesołowska & van Harten, 2007: 248, sub Pseudicius).

Gen. Asemonea O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1869 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02828] Detail
type Lyssomanes tenuipes O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1869; gender feminine
N.B.: the spelling Asamonea is a lapsus.
Transferred to other genera:
Asemonea pallens (Blackwall, 1877) -- see Goleba
Asemonea puella Simon, 1885 -- see Goleba
Asemonea punctata Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 -- see Goleba
In synonymy:
Asemonea andamanensis (Tikader, 1977, T from Lyssomanes) = Asemonea tenuipes (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1869) (Wanless, 1980d: 241).
Asemonea bella Lenz, 1891 = Asemonea ornatissima Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 (Wanless, 1980d: 239).
Asemonea bengalensis (Tikader & Biswas, 1978, T from Lyssomanes) = Asemonea tenuipes (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1869) (Wanless, 1980d: 241).

Asemonea picta Thorell, 1895 = Asemonea cristata Thorell, 1895 (Sudhin et al., 2020: 252).
Asemonea santinagarensis (Biswas & Biswas, 1992) = Asemonea cristata Thorell, 1895 (Sudhin et al., 2020: 252).

Gen. Astia L. Koch, 1879 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02831] Detail
N.B.: Wanless, 1988: 84 retained Vindima Thorell, 1895 in the synonymy of this genus, apparently as a clerical error since he earlier removed that name to the synonymy of Cyrba Simon, 1876 and did not include the type species of Vindima in his list of Astia species.
Transferred to other genera:
Astia aurea L. Koch, 1880 -- see Arasia
Astia colemani Wanless, 1988 -- see Helpis
Astia maculata (Thorell, 1895) -- see Cyrba
Astia nodosa L. Koch, 1879 -- see Adoxotoma
Astia tristicula Simon, 1909 -- see Sondra
Nomen dubium:
Astia ornata Peckham & Peckham, 1885a: 32 (Madagascar) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1418.

Astia hariola Prószyński, 2017b: 119, f. 52B, 53B (mf).

Gen. Attulus Simon, 1889 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02836] Detail
type Attus helveolus Simon, 1871 (replacement name for Attus cinereus Westring, 1861; preoccupied by Walckenaer, 1837), synonym of Attulus distinguendus; gender masculine
N.B.: Redefined and seperated from Sitticus Simon, 1901 by Prószyński, 2017: 39. The re-synonymization of Attulus, Calositticus and Hypositticus with Sitticus by Breitling, 2019b: 31 was not accepted, because based mainly on COI (see FAQ 7). Maddison et al., 2020: 11-12 syonymize the genera Sitticus Simon, 1901 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03232] (type species Araneus terebratus Clerck, 1757), Sitticulus F. Dahl, 1926 (type species Attus saltator O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1868), Calositticus Lohmander, 1944 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04474] (type species Attus caricis Westring, 1861), Hypositticus Lohmander, 1944 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04475] and Sittipub Prószyński, 2016 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04364] (both with the type species Aranea pubescens Fabricius, 1775), Sittiflor Prószyński, 2017 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04396] (type species Euophrys floricola C. L. Koch, 1837), and Sittilong Prószyński, 2017 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04397] (type species Attus longipes Canestrini, 1873), with Attulus. Sitticulus was synonymized with Sitticus by Prószyński, 1973a: 72 (through transfer of type species) and through transfer of type species by Prószyński, 2017: 39 regarded as synonym of Attulus. Calositticus and Hypositticus were described as  subgenera of Sitticus, elevated to genus rank and recognized as older synonyms of Sittiflor and Sittipub by Blick & Marusik, 2018: 237.
Transferred to other genera:
Attulus albifrons (Lucas, 1846) -- see Yllenus
Attulus auriceps Denis, 1966 -- see Yllenus
Attulus auspex (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885) -- see Yllenus
Attulus saliens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1876) -- see Yllenus
Attulus salsicola Simon, 1937 -- see Yllenus
Attulus squamifer (Simon, 1881) -- see Yllenus
Attulus tschoni Caporiacco, 1936 -- see Yllenus
Attulus validus Simon, 1889 -- see Yllenus
In synonymy:
Attulus alpicola (Kulczyński, 1887) = Attulus atricapillus (Simon, 1882) (Kronestedt & Logunov, 2003: 858, sub Sitticus, contra Prószyński & Starega, 1971: 289).

Attulus decorus (Thorell, 1875) = Attulus pubescens (Fabricius, 1775) (Prószyński, 1987: 96, sub Sitticus).
Attulus floricola orientalis (Strand, 1906) = Attulus floricola (C. L. Koch, 1837) (Prószyński, 1987: 167, sub Sitticus).
Attulus floricola palustris (Peckham & Peckham, 1883) = Attulus floricola (C. L. Koch, 1837) (Maddison et al., 2020: 16, T from Calositticus).
Attulus frigidus (Simon, 1875) = Attulus distinguendus (Simon, 1868) (Prószyński, 1983d: 166, sub Sitticus).
Attulus gertschi (Prószyński, 1980) = Attulus cutleri (Prószyński, 1980) (Nenilin, 1984b: 1179, sub Sitticus).
Attulus guttatus (Thorell, 1875) = Attulus penicillatus (Simon, 1875) (Prószyński, 1973a: 72, older name suppressed by ICZN Opinion 1612, sub Sitticus).
Attulus helveolus (Simon, 1871) = Attulus distinguendus (Simon, 1868) (Prószyński, 2017a: 39).
Attulus histrio (Simon, 1875) = Attulus distinguendus (Simon, 1868) (Prószyński, 1983d: 166, sub Sitticus).
Attulus hungaricus (Kulczyński, 1891) = Attulus zimmermanni (Simon, 1877) (Prószyński & Starega, 1971: 289, sub Sitticus).
Attulus illibatus (Simon, 1868) = Attulus penicillatus (Simon, 1875) (Prószyński, 1973a: 72, older name suppressed by ICZN Opinion 1612, sub Sitticus, T from Attulus).
Attulus inaequalipes (Simon, 1868) = Attulus penicillatus (Simon, 1875) (Prószyński, 1973a: 72, older name suppressed by ICZN Opinion 1612, sub Sitticus, T from Attulus).
Attulus lineatus (Denis, 1950) = Attulus rivalis (Simon, 1937) (Logunov, 2004a: 35, sub Sitticus, contra Prószyński, 1980: 27).
Attulus magnus (Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944) = Attulus sylvestris (Emerton, 1891) (Maddison et al., 2020: 21, T from Calositticus).
Attulus mancus (Thorell, 1873) = Attulus floricola (C. L. Koch, 1837) (Prószyński, 1971e: 473, sub Sitticus).

Attulus psammodes (Thorell, 1875) = Attulus distinguendus (Simon, 1868) (Prószyński, 1987: 95, sub Sitticus).
Attulus rapax (Thorell, 1873) = Attulus dzieduszyckii (L. Koch, 1870) (Prószyński, 1987: 96, sub Sitticus).
Attulus ruficarpus (Simon, 1884) = Attulus distinguendus (Simon, 1868) (Prószyński, 1987: 94, 137, sub Sitticus, T from Attulus).

Attulus sexsignatus (Franganillo, 1910) = Attulus floricola (C. L. Koch, 1837) (Breitling et al., 2016b: 55, sub Sitticus).
Attulus sibiricus (Roewer, 1951) = Attulus avocator (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885) (Prószyński, 2017a, (confirming Prószyński & Zochowska, 1981: 26, sub Sitticus viduus (Kulczyński, 1895), a junior homonym; contra Marusik, Mikhailov & Omelko, 2015: 120)).
Attulus strandi (Kolosváry, 1934) = Attulus rupicola (C. L. Koch, 1837) (Prószyński, 1980: 14, sub Sitticus).
Attulus tullgreni (Holm, 1945) = Attulus zimmermanni (Simon, 1877) (Prószyński & Starega, 1971: 289, sub Sitticus).

Gen. Ballus C. L. Koch, 1850 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02843] Detail
type Salticus heterophthalmus Wider, 1834, syn. of Ballus chalybeius (Walckenaer, 1802)
Transferred to other genera:
Ballus cinctipes (Banks, 1900) -- see Attidops
Ballus decempunctatus Szombathy, 1915 -- see Porius
Ballus planus Schenkel, 1936 -- see Rhene
Ballus youngi Peckham & Peckham, 1888 -- see Attidops
In synonymy:
Ballus depressus poecilopus Förster & Bertkau, 1883 (omitted by Roewer) = Ballus rufipes (Simon, 1868) (Alicata & Cantarella, 1988: 48).
Ballus seguipes (Simon, 1868, removed from S of B. biimpressus) = Ballus chalybeius (Walckenaer, 1802) (Alicata & Cantarella, 1988: 42, sub B. depressus).
Nomina dubia:
Ballus lendli Kolosváry, 1934b: 17, f. 21 (f, Hungary) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:032405] -- Breitling et al., 2016b: 58, confirming Samu & Szinetár, 1999: 162.
Ballus obscuroides (Canestrini & Pavesi, 1868: 869, m, Italy, originally in Euophrys) -- Brignoli, 1983b: 564.
Ballus sociabilis Franganillo, 1910: 18, f. 9 (f, Portugal) -- Alicata & Cantarella, 1988: 54, confirmed by Breitling et al., 2016b: 56.
Ballus vulpinus (Westring, 1851: 56 (f, Sweden, originally in Attus) -- Alicata & Cantarella, 1988: 54.
Nomen nudum:
Ballus clathratus Simon, 1901a: 482, 485 (Sri Lanka) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:051408] -- Bonnet, 1955: 844.

Gen. Bianor Peckham & Peckham, 1886 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02854] Detail
type Scythropa maculata Keyserling, 1883; gender masculine
N.B.: Replacement name for Scythropa Keyserling, 1883, preoccupied. Synonym of Stichius Thorell, 1890 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03243], type Stichius albomaculatus (Logunov, 2019: 102). Not a senior synonym of Modunda Simon, 1901 and Napoca Simon, 1901 (Logunov, 2001a: 276, 280), contra Prószyński, 1990: 223.
Transferred to other genera:
Bianor aemulus (Gertsch, 1934) -- see Sibianor
Bianor aeneiceps (Simon, 1901) -- see Modunda
Bianor aeneus Mello-Leitão, 1945 -- see Beata
Bianor apertus (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) -- see Thyene
Bianor aurocinctus (Ohlert, 1865) -- see Sibianor
Bianor bellus (Karsch, 1878) -- see Opisthoncus
Bianor congener (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Modunda
Bianor fulvipes Mello-Leitão, 1943 -- see Dendryphantes
Bianor ghigii (Caporiacco, 1949) -- see Ureta
Bianor inexploratus Logunov, 1991 -- see Sibianor
Bianor insignis (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Napoca
Bianor japonicus Logunov, Ikeda & Ono, 1997 -- see Sibianor
Bianor latens Logunov, 1991 -- see Harmochirus
Bianor marionis Schmidt & Krause, 1994 -- see Pellenes
Bianor orientalis (Dönitz & Strand, 1906) -- see Modunda
Bianor phragmitis (Simon, 1901) -- see Modunda
Bianor piratus Sen, Dhali, Saha & Raychaudhuri, 2015 -- see Carrhotus
Bianor pullus Bösenberg & Strand, 1906 -- see Sibianor
Bianor staintoni (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Modunda
Bianor stepposus Logunov, 1991 -- see Pellenes
In synonymy:
Bianor albomaculatus (Thorell, 1890) = Bianor angulosus (Karsch, 1879) (Logunov, 2019: 101).
Bianor carli Reimoser, 1934 = Bianor balius Thorell, 1890 (Logunov, 2001a: 236, sub B. incitatus).
Bianor hotingchiehi Schenkel, 1963 = Bianor angulosus (Karsch, 1879) (Logunov, 2001a: 231).
Bianor incitatus Thorell, 1890 = Bianor balius Thorell, 1890 (Logunov, 2019: 102).
Bianor leucostictus (Thorell, 1890) = Bianor angulosus (Karsch, 1879) (Logunov, 2019: 101).
Bianor obak Berry, Beatty & Prószyński, 1996 = Bianor balius Thorell, 1890 (Logunov, 2001a: 236, sub B. incitatus).
Bianor pulchellus Wesołowska & van Harten, 1994 = Bianor albobimaculatus (Lucas, 1846) (Logunov, 2001a: 225).
Bianor putus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) = Bianor albobimaculatus (Lucas, 1846) (Logunov, 2001a: 225, after Prószyński, 1990).
Bianor rusticulus Peckham & Peckham, 1903 = Bianor albobimaculatus (Lucas, 1846) (Logunov, 2001a: 225).
Bianor scutatus Wesołowska & van Harten, 1994 = Bianor albobimaculatus (Lucas, 1846) (Logunov, 2001a: 225).
Bianor simoni Żabka, 1985 = Bianor angulosus (Karsch, 1879) (Logunov, 2001a: 231).
Bianor trepidans Thorell, 1895 = Bianor angulosus (Karsch, 1879) (Logunov, 2001a: 231).
Nomen dubium:
Bianor fimbriatus Mello-Leitão, 1917c: 146 (j, Brazil) -- Logunov, 2001a: 281.

Gen. Carrhotus Thorell, 1891 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02872] Detail
type Plexippus viduus C. L. Koch, 1846; gender masculine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Eugasmia Simon, 1902 by Prószyński, 1984a: 16 (by transfer of type species), and of Diagondas Simon, 1902, type D. viridiaureus Simon, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02924] by Maddison, 2015: 249.
Transferred to other genera:
Carrhotus chlorophthalmus (Simon, 1909) -- see Maratus
Carrhotus oscitans (Pocock, 1898) -- see Bindax
Carrhotus rufus Caporiacco, 1947 -- see Frigga
Carrhotus semiaurantiacus Simon, 1909 -- see Dasycyptus
In synonymy:
Carrhotus crinitus (Karsch, 1879, T from Hasarius) = Carrhotus xanthogramma (Latreille, 1819) (Prószyński, 1973b: 100).
Carrhotus decorata (Tikader, 1974) = Carrhotus viduus (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Caleb, Bera & Acharya, 2020: 61, T from Marpissa).
Carrhotus detritus Bösenberg & Strand, 1906 = Carrhotus xanthogramma (Latreille, 1819) (Prószyński, 1973b: 100).
Carrhotus dimidiatus (Grube, 1861, originally in Attus, T from Salticus sub nomen dubium) = Carrhotus xanthogramma (Latreille, 1819) (Marusik, Mikhailov & Omelko, 2015: 120).
Carrhotus gajbei (Karthikeyani & Kannan, 2013) = Carrhotus viduus (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Caleb, 2016b: 273).
Carrhotus kevinlii Cao & Li, 2016 = Carrhotus yunnanensis (Song, 1991) (Caleb, Bera & Acharya, 2020: 65).
Carrhotus lakshmikantapurensis (Majumder, 2004) = Carrhotus viduus (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Caleb, Bera & Acharya, 2020: 61, T from Marpissa).
Carrhotus ornatus (Simon, 1885, T from Mogrus) = Carrhotus viduus (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Andreeva, Kononenko & Prószyński, 1981: 103).
Carrhotus pichoni Schenkel, 1963 = Carrhotus xanthogramma (Latreille, 1819) (Wesołowska, 1981b: 128).
Carrhotus piratus (Sen, Dhali, Saha & Raychaudhuri, 2015) = Carrhotus sannio (Thorell, 1877) (Caleb, Bera & Acharya, 2020: 58, T from Bianor).
Carrhotus rubrosquamulatus (Dönitz & Strand, 1906, T from Dendryphantes) = Carrhotus xanthogramma (Latreille, 1819) (Yaginuma, 1962c: 46, sub C. detritus).
Carrhotus tikaderi (Biswas, 1984) = Carrhotus viduus (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Caleb, Bera & Acharya, 2020: 61, T from Marpissa).
Carrhotus varicus (Simon, 1868) = Carrhotus xanthogramma (Latreille, 1819) (Breitling et al., 2016b: 65, confirming Simon, 1937: 1270).

Carrhotus aeneochelis Strand, 1907m: 454 (mf, Indonesia/Java) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:032613] -- Nentwig et al., 2020: 25.

Gen. Chira Peckham & Peckham, 1896 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02887] Detail
type Shira designata Peckham & Peckham, 1896; gender feminine; syn. of Chira trivittata (Taczanowski, 1871)
N.B.: Shira is the original spelling, Simon, 1902d: 51 emended it to Chira and Galiano, 1989c proposed to conserve this spelling, which is still used here until the ICZN decides on the proposal; considered a senior synonym of Ilarginus Mello-Leitão, 1939 by Galiano, 1961b: 161; of Alcimonotus Simon, 1902 (itself considered a senior synonym of Goya Mello-Leitão, 1945 by Galiano, 1961a: 322) by Galiano, 1968b: 350; and of Crulsia Mello-Leitão, 1930 by Galiano, 1980b: 37.
Transferred to other genera:
Chira albiocciput Bösenberg & Strand, 1906 -- see Phintelloides
Chira luctuosa Simon, 1902 -- see Phiale
Chira micans (Simon, 1902) -- see Philira
Chira portai Caporiacco, 1954 -- see Frigga
Chira spinipes (Taczanowski, 1871) -- see Eustiromastix
Chira spinosa Mello-Leitão, 1945 -- see Saitis
Chira superba Caporiacco, 1947 -- see Philira
In synonymy:
Chira aculeata Simon, 1902 = Chira guianensis (Taczanowski, 1871) (Galiano, 1968b: 350).
Chira albovittata (Mello-Leitão, 1948, T from Corythalia) = Chira trivittata (Taczanowski, 1871) (Galiano, 1961b: 183).
Chira aurantia (Mello-Leitão, 1945, T from Alfenus) = Chira spinosa (Mello-Leitão, 1939) (Galiano, 1961b: 176).
Chira aurantiovittata (Mello-Leitão, 1945, T from Akela) = Chira spinosa (Mello-Leitão, 1939) (Galiano, 1968b: 363).
Chira bicirculigera Soares & Camargo, 1948 = Chira spinosa (Mello-Leitão, 1939) (Galiano, 1961b: 176).
Chira cincta (Mello-Leitão, 1942, T from Phiale) = Chira spinosa (Mello-Leitão, 1939) (Galiano, 1961b: 176).
Chira designata Peckham & Peckham, 1896 = Chira trivittata (Taczanowski, 1871) (Galiano, 1968b: 355).
Chira elegantula (Mello-Leitão, 1947, T from Asaracus) = Chira thysbe Simon, 1902 (Edwards, Rinaldi & Ruiz, 2005: 27).
Chira ferrugineonotata (Mello-Leitão, 1945, T from Akela) = Chira gounellei (Simon, 1902) (Galiano, 1968b: 360).
Chira kastoni Caporiacco, 1947 = Chira lucina Simon, 1902 (Galiano, 1961b: 171).
Chira pallida (Mello-Leitão, 1948, T from Philaeus) = Chira thysbe Simon, 1902 (Galiano, 1961b: 181).
Chira pseudothysbe Soares & Camargo, 1948 = Chira thysbe Simon, 1902 (Galiano, 1961b: 181).
Chira spinosa (Mello-Leitão, 1945, originally in Goya) = Chira gounellei (Simon, 1902) (Galiano, 1961a: 322, sub Alcimonotus).
Chira taeniata (Mello-Leitão, 1943, T from Mago) = Chira thysbe Simon, 1902 (Galiano, 1968b: 358).
Chira trimaculata (Mello-Leitão, 1943, T from Anaurus) = Chira spinosa (Mello-Leitão, 1939) (Galiano, 1968b: 361).

Gen. Coryphasia Simon, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02905] Detail
type Coryphasia albibarbis Simon, 1902; gender feminine
N.B. considered a senior synonym of Asaphobelis Simon, 1902 and of Siloca Simon, 1902: 389 (type Siloca sanguiniceps Simon, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03226]) by Zhang & Maddison, 2015: 23, synonymy of Asaphobelis rejected by Prószyński, 2017b: 74.

Gen. Corythalia C. L. Koch, 1850 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02906] Detail
type Euophrys latipes C. L. Koch, 1846; gender feminine
N.B.: for unexplained reasons, Roewer did not accept the synonymy of Makthalia Badcock, 1932 with this genus proposed by Mello-Leitão, 1939e: 84; considered a senior synonym of Taeoma Mello-Leitão, 1939 by Galiano, 1962c: 15, and of Dinattus Bryant, 1943: 482, type Dinattus heros Bryant, 1943  [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02925] by Zhang & Maddison, 2015: 15.
Transferred to other genera:
Corythalia albovittata Mello-Leitão, 1948 -- see Chira
Corythalia arcuata Franganillo, 1930 -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia argyrochrysos (Mello-Leitão, 1946) -- see Pachomius
Corythalia aurata (Hentz, 1846) -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia banksi Roewer, 1951 -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia canalis (Chamberlin, 1925) -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia canosa (Walckenaer, 1837) -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia crucifera (Keyserling, 1885) -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia cubana Roewer, 1951 -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia delicatula Gertsch & Mulaik, 1936 -- see Chalcoscirtus
Corythalia elegantissima (Simon, 1888) -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia emertoni Bryant, 1940 -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia gloriae Petrunkevitch, 1930 -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia heliophanina (Taczanowski, 1871) -- see Neonella
Corythalia locuples (Simon, 1888) -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia peckhami Petrunkevitch, 1914 -- see Anasaitis
Corythalia serrapophysis (Chamberlin & Ivie, 1936) -- see Maeota
Corythalia squamata Bryant, 1940 -- see Anasaitis
In synonymy:
Corythalia barbipes (Mello-Leitão, 1939) = Corythalia cincta (Badcock, 1932) (Bayer, Höfer & Metzner, 2020: 49).
Corythalia endigma Chamberlin & Ivie, 1936 = Corythalia obsoleta Banks, 1929 (Chickering, 1946: 145).
Corythalia fulvoguttata (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901) = Corythalia opima (Peckham & Peckham, 1885) (Chickering, 1946: 145, confirmed by Bayer, Höfer & Metzner, 2020: 110).
Corythalia lutea (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901) = Corythalia parvula (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Chickering, 1946: 146).
Corythalia sitticus Chamberlin & Ivie, 1936 = Corythalia bicincta Petrunkevitch, 1925 (Chickering, 1946: 132).
Corythalia tulineba (Chamberlin & Ivie, 1936) = Corythalia bicincta Petrunkevitch, 1925 (Chickering, 1946: 132, T from Sidusa).
Corythalia vittata (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901, T from Tylogonus) = Corythalia nigropicta (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901) (Kraus, 1955b: 66).
Nomina dubia:
Corythalia magnus (Walckenaer, 1837: 453, mf, USA, originally in Attus) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 84.
Corythalia variegata Caporiacco, 1954: 179, f. 67 (j, French Guiana) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:032929] -- Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008c: 493, confirmed by Bayer, Höfer & Metzner, 2020: 119.
Nomina nuda:
Corythalia dimidiata Simon, 1901a: 654 -- confirmed by Bayer, Höfer & Metzner, 2020: 120.
Corythalia major Simon, 1901a: 655 -- confirmed by Bayer, Höfer & Metzner, 2020: 120.

Gen. Cosmophasis Simon, 1901 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02907] Detail
Transferred to other genera:
Cosmophasis archeyi Berland, 1931 -- see Clynotis
Cosmophasis australis Simon, 1902 -- see Phintella
Cosmophasis caerulea Simon, 1901 -- see Mexcala
Cosmophasis cincta Denis, 1947 -- see Mexcala
Cosmophasis collingwoodi (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1871) -- see Siler
Cosmophasis fagei Lessert, 1925 -- see Icius
Cosmophasis ichneumon Simon, 1901 -- see Orsima
Cosmophasis insultans (Thorell, 1881) -- see Margaromma
Cosmophasis natalensis Lawrence, 1942 -- see Mexcala
Cosmophasis nigrocyanea (Simon, 1885) -- see Mexcala
Cosmophasis quadrimaculata Lawrence, 1942 -- see Mexcala
Cosmophasis tristis Berland & Millot, 1941 -- see Mexcala
Cosmophasis undulata Caleb & Karthikeyani, 2015 -- see Phintelloides
In synonymy:
Cosmophasis marxi (Thorell, 1890) = Cosmophasis ombria (Thorell, 1877) (Żabka & Waldock, 2012: 129).
Cosmophasis muralis Berry, Beatty & Prószyński, 1997 = Cosmophasis tristriatus (L. Koch, 1880) (Żabka & Waldock, 2012: 127).

Gen. Cotinusa Simon, 1900 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02908] Detail
type Sadala distincta Peckham & Peckham, 1888; gender feminine
N.B.: replacement name for Sadala Peckham & Peckham, 1888: 53, preoccuppied by Simon, 1880a: 317 in Sparassidae (syn. of Olios); considered a senior synonym of Gophoa Simon, 1901 by Galiano, 1963a: 360 and of Gertschnusa Mello-Leitão, 1947 by Galiano, 1980b: 38.
Transferred to other genera:
Cotinusa humillima Mello-Leitão, 1943 -- see Helvetia
In synonymy:
Cotinusa falcigera (Simon, 1901) = Cotinusa horatia (Peckham & Peckham, 1894) (Galiano, 1963a: 360).
Cotinusa tristis (Mello-Leitão, 1945, T from Balmaceda) = Cotinusa trifasciata (Mello-Leitão, 1943) (Galiano, 1963b: 2).

type Salticus algerinus Lucas, 1846; gender feminine

In synonymy:
Dendryphantes iricolor (Nicolet, 1849, T from Attus=Salticus) = Dendryphantes mordax (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008a: 535).
Dendryphantes jucundus (C. L. Koch, 1846, T from Phiale) = Dendryphantes mordax (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Galiano, 1979d: 342).
Dendryphantes scalaris (Nicolet, 1849, T from Attus=Salticus) = Dendryphantes mordax (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008a: 535).
Dendryphantes superbus (Nicolet, 1849, T from Attus=Salticus) = Dendryphantes mordax (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008a: 535).
Dendryphantes thorelli Kulczyński, 1895 = Dendryphantes fusconotatus (Grube, 1861) (Prószyński, 1979: 305).
Dendryphantes tristis (Mello-Leitão, 1940, T from Euophrys) = Dendryphantes patagonicus Simon, 1905 (Galiano, 1962d: 182).
Dendryphantes zonarius (Nicolet, 1849, T from Attus=Salticus) = Dendryphantes mordax (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008a: 536).

Gen. Emertonius Peckham & Peckham, 1892 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04454] Detail
type Emertonius exasperans Peckham & Peckham, 1892
N.B. Considered a junior synonym of Myrmarachne MacLeay, 1839 by Wanless, 1978b: 235 (for an alternate view, see Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2010: 162 but also Edwards, 2013a: 4); revalidation of Emertonius by Prószyński, 2016 was not accepted, because the rejection of Edwards, 2013a was not taken into account; synonymy finally rejected by Prószyński, 2018b: 165.

Emertonius exasperans Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2010: 164-167, 169-171 (f).
Myrmarachne exasperans Hill & Otto, 2015: 1, f. 1.1-4 (mf habitus).
Emertonius exasperans Prószyński, 2016: 4 (revalidation is not accepted here, see note at the genus Emertonius).
Emertonius exasperans Prószyński, 2017b: 100, f. 45A1-4, 45C1-2, 46A (f, T from Myrmarachne, but Emertonius not revalidated).

Gen. Epeus Peckham & Peckham, 1886 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02939] Detail
type Evenus tener Simon, 1877; gender masculine
N.B.: replacement name for Evenus Simon, 1877b: 58, preoccupied in Lepidoptera by Hübner, 1819, as well as in Coleoptera and Mollusca (see Bonnet, 1956: 1875); removed from the synonymy of Viciria Thorell, 1877 by Prószyński, 1984b: 403; apparently considered a senior synonym of Taupoa Peckham & Peckham, 1907 (by transfer of type species) by Prószyński, 1984a: 143.

Gen. Euophrys C. L. Koch, 1834 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02946] Detail
type Aranea frontalis Walckenaer, 1802; gender feminine
N.B.: Evophrys is an unjustified emendation; the subgenera Frigga and Aphirape were elevated to generic status by Galiano, 1979b:114, and Galiano, 1981e: 95, respectively; not a synonym of Cyrene=Nycerella (Galiano, 1982b: 54) or of Pseudeuophrys Dahl, 1912 (Żabka, 1997: 76; Logunov, 1998b: 111).

In synonymy:
Euophrys graeca Bristowe, 1935 = Euophrys sulphurea (L. Koch, 1867) (Metzner, 1999: 51).
Euophrys lusitanicus (Simon, 1901, T from Saitis) = Euophrys difficilis (Simon, 1868) (Logunov, 2005: 14).
Euophrys molesta O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1912 (removed from S of E. aequipes) = Euophrys herbigrada (Simon, 1871) (Clark in Locket, Millidge & Merrett, 1974: 29).
Euophrys nearctica Kaston, 1938 = Euophrys monadnock Emerton, 1891 (Edwards, 1980: 12).
Euophrys nigrimana (Mello-Leitão, 1945, T from Saitis) = Euophrys melanoleuca Mello-Leitão, 1944 (Galiano, 1962d: 172).
Euophrys rufibarbis comptula (Simon, 1871) = Euophrys rufibarbis (Simon, 1868) (Prószyński, 1987: 143).

Gen. Eustiromastix Simon, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02949] Detail
N.B.: nomen novum for Cybele Peckham & Peckham, 1894b: 695; preoccupied in Crustacea by Lovén, 1845. Sometimes the erroneous typing "Eustyromastix" was used (e.g. Simon, 1903a: 724)
Transferred to other genera:
Eustiromastix pantherinus Mello-Leitão, 1942 -- see Sumampattus
Eustiromastix parobscurus Roewer, 1951 -- see Sumampattus
Eustiromastix rufohirtus Simon, 1902 -- see Freya
In synonymy:
Eustiromastix affinis (Caporiacco, 1954, T from Thiratoscirtus) = Eustiromastix major Simon, 1902 (Galiano, 1979a: 174).
Eustiromastix guianensis (Caporiacco, 1947, originally in Freya) = Eustiromastix spinipes (Taczanowski, 1871) (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008c: 492).
Eustiromastix styliferus Simon, 1902 = Eustiromastix major Simon, 1902 (Galiano, 1979a: 174).
Nomen dubium:
Eustiromastix chaperi Simon, 1902a: 417 (m, Colombia) -- Galiano, 1979a: 185.

Gen. Evarcha Simon, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02950] Detail
type Araneus falcatus Clerck, 1757; gender feminine
N.B.: The synonymy of this genus with Pellenes Simon, 1876 (Lowrie & Gertsch, 1955: 10) has not been accepted by subsequent workers; considered a senior synonym of Colopsus Simon, 1902 (type Colopsus cancellatus Simon, 1902) by Prószyński, 1984a: 51 (see also Blick & Marusik, 2018: 237). Split into several genera by Prószyński, 2018b; leaving 15 species in Evarcha s. lat., listed as "Evarcha [?]". The genera Evacin Prószyński, 2018 [type Evarcha kochi Simon, 1902] (furthermore Evacin would be a synonym of Colopsus Simon, 1902, see Blick & Marusik, 2018), Evalba Prószyński, 2018 [type Evarcha albaria (L. Koch, 1878), originally in Hasarius], Evaneg Prószyński, 2018 [type Evarcha negevensis Prószyński, 2000] and Evawes Prószyński, 2018 [type Evarcha patagiata (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872), originally in Salticus] are not accepted here (cf. Kropf et al., 2019).
Transferred to other genera:
Evarcha afghana Roewer, 1962 -- see Plexippoides
Evarcha albopilosa Tyschchenko, 1965 -- see Pellenes
Evarcha bicuspidata Peng & Li, 2003 -- see Orientattus
Evarcha capistrata (C. L. Koch, 1846) -- see Bavia
Evarcha cara Wesolowska & van Harten, 1994 -- see Hyllus
Evarcha cornigera (Wesolowska & van Harten, 1994) -- see Hyllus
Evarcha crassipes (Karsch, 1881) -- see Pancorius
Evarcha digitata Peng & Li, 2002 -- see Ptocasius
Evarcha dotata (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) -- see Hyllus
Evarcha hirticeps (Song & Chai, 1992) -- see Nigorella
Evarcha hunanensis Peng, Xie & Kim, 1993 -- see Nigorella
Evarcha lapponica (Sundevall, 1833) -- see Pellenes
Evarcha leucophaea (C. L. Koch, 1846) -- see Pelegrina
Evarcha longipalpis Bösenberg & Strand, 1906 -- see Hasarius
Evarcha morigera (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) -- see Brancus
Evarcha mustela (Simon, 1902) -- see Brancus
Evarcha natalica Simon, 1902 -- see Thyenula
Evarcha parmata (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) -- see Brancus
Evarcha petrae Prószyński, 1992 -- see Nigorella
Evarcha sichuanensis Peng, Xie & Kim, 1993 -- see Nigorella
Evarcha tropica Mello-Leitão, 1939 -- see Corythalia
Evarcha venezuelica Caporiacco, 1955 -- see Asaracus
Evarcha ventrilineata (Strand, 1906) -- see Hyllus
Evarcha wenxianensis Tang & Yang, 1995 -- see Yaginumaella
In synonymy:
Evarcha albifrons (Kulczyński, 1895) = Evarcha albaria (L. Koch, 1878) (Prószyński, 1973b: 104).
Evarcha elegans Wesołowska & Russell-Smith, 2000 = Evarcha werneri (Simon, 1906) (Logunov & Azarkina, 2018: 110).
Evarcha eriki Wunderlich, 1987 = Evarcha jucunda (Lucas, 1846) (Wunderlich, 2017b: 317).
Evarcha falcata nigrofusca (Strand, 1900) = Evarcha falcata (Clerck, 1757) (Breitling et al., 2016b: 64).
Evarcha flavipes (Keyserling, 1882, T from Habrocestum) = Evarcha infrastriata (Keyserling, 1881) (Żabka, 1991c: 27).
Evarcha lamperti (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906, T from Hasarius) = Evarcha albaria (L. Koch, 1878) (Prószyński, 1973b: 104).
Evarcha pichoni Schenkel, 1963 = Evarcha albaria (L. Koch, 1878) (Prószyński, 1990: 136).
Evarcha pseudolaetabunda Peng & Xie, 1994 = Evarcha mongolica Danilov & Logunov, 1994 (Logunov & Marusik, 2001: 93).
Homonym replaced:
Evarcha similis Wesolowska & Russell-Smith, 2000 -- see Evarcha prosimilis
Nomen dubium:
Evarcha flammata (Clerck, 1757: 124, pl. 5, f. 18, f, Sweden, originally in Araneus) -- Roberts, 1993: 3.

Evarcha acuta Wesołowska, 2006b: 230, f. 23-25 (Dm).

Gen. Frigga C. L. Koch, 1850 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02956] Detail
type Euophrys coronigera C. L. Koch, 1846; gender feminine
N.B.: elevated from a subgenus of Euophrys C. L. Koch, 1834 by Galiano, 1979b: 114.
In synonymy:
Frigga bispinosa (Banks, 1931, T from Phiale) = Frigga crocuta (Taczanowski, 1878) (Galiano, 1979f: 691, sub Phiale, contra Roth & Craig, 1970: 121).

Gen. Habronattus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02975] Detail
N.B.: elevated from a subgenus of Pellenes Simon, 1876 by Griswold, 1987a: 58.
In synonymy:
Habronattus angelus (Chamberlin, 1924, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus signatus (Banks, 1900) (Griswold, 1987a: 179).
Habronattus arizonensis (Banks, 1904, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus conjunctus (Banks, 1898) (Griswold, 1987a: 185).
Habronattus belligerus (Peckham & Peckham, 1896, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus mexicanus (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Griswold, 1987a: 113).
Habronattus birgei (Peckham & Peckham, 1901, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus conjunctus (Banks, 1898) (Griswold, 1987a: 185).
Habronattus brunneus insignis Bryant, 1942 (T from Pellenes) = Habronattus brunneus (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Griswold, 1987a: 120).
Habronattus cambridgei (Kraus, 1955, T from Pellenes, not H. c. Bryant, 1948) = Habronattus banksi (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Griswold, 1987a: 164).
Habronattus dolosus (Peckham & Peckham, 1901, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus hirsutus (Peckham & Peckham, 1888) (Griswold, 1987a: 199).
Habronattus eleganoides (Chamberlin & Ivie, 1941, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus peckhami (Banks, 1921) (Griswold, 1987a: 195).
Habronattus eleganoides suranus (Chamberlin & Ivie, 1941, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus peckhami (Banks, 1921) (Griswold, 1987a: 195).
Habronattus griseus (Peckham & Peckham, 1901, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus festus (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Griswold, 1987a: 124).
Habronattus hondurasus (Roewer, 1951, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus mexicanus (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Griswold, 1987a: 112).
Habronattus hutchinsoni (Peckham & Peckham, 1909, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus tarsalis (Banks, 1904) (Richman & Cutler, 1978: 94, sub Pellenes).
Habronattus mimulus (Chamberlin & Gertsch, 1929, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus hirsutus (Peckham & Peckham, 1888) (Griswold, 1987a: 199).
Habronattus mundus (Peckham & Peckham, 1909, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus amicus (Peckham & Peckham, 1909) (Griswold, 1987a: 173).
Habronattus nigripes (Chamberlin & Ivie, 1941, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus americanus (Keyserling, 1885) (Griswold, 1987a: 75).
Habronattus perfidus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 (T from Pellenes) = Habronattus banksi (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Griswold, 1987a: 163).
Habronattus philipi (Gertsch & Jellison, 1939, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus jucundus (Peckham & Peckham, 1909) (Griswold, 1987a: 141).
Habronattus politus (Peckham & Peckham, 1901, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus conjunctus (Banks, 1898) (Griswold, 1987a: 185).
Habronattus polius (Chamberlin, 1924, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus ammophilus (Chamberlin, 1924) (Griswold, 1987a: 118).
Habronattus rutherfordi (Gertsch & Mulaik, 1936, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus texanus (Chamberlin, 1924) (Griswold, 1987a: 215).
Habronattus scotsdalei (Peckham & Peckham, 1909, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus tranquillus (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Griswold, 1987a: 196).
Habronattus tachypodus Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944 (T from Pellenes) = Habronattus carolinensis (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Griswold, 1987a: 223).
Habronattus umatillus (Peckham & Peckham, 1909, T from Pellenes) = Habronattus amicus (Peckham & Peckham, 1909) (Griswold, 1987a: 174).

Gen. Harmochirus Simon, 1885 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02977] Detail
type Harmochirus malaccensis Simon, 1885; gender masculine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Valloa Peckham & Peckham, 1903 by Wesolowska, 1994: 198, contra Galiano, 1972.
Transferred to other genera:
Harmochirus kochiensis Bohdanowicz & Prószyński, 1987 -- see Sibianor
Harmochirus latens (Logunov, 1991) -- see Sibianor
Harmochirus nigriculus Logunov & Wesolowska, 1992 -- see Sibianor
Harmochirus proszynski Zhu & Song, 2001 -- see Sibianor
Harmochirus pullus (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) -- see Sibianor
In synonymy:
Harmochirus albibarbis Peckham & Peckham, 1895 = Harmochirus luculentus Simon, 1886 (Logunov, 2001a: 254).
Harmochirus elegans (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) = Harmochirus luculentus Simon, 1886 (Logunov, 2001a: 254).
Harmochirus niger Kishida, 1910 = Harmochirus pullus (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) (Logunov, Ikeda & Ono, 1997: 7).
Nomina dubia:
Harmochirus modestus (Peckham & Peckham, 1903: 217, pl. 24, f. 9, m, South Africa, originally in Valloa) -- Wesołowska, 1994: 206, Logunov, 2001a: 282.
Harmochirus rufescens Caporiacco, 1940b: 304, f. 4 (f, Somalia) -- Wesołowska, 1994: 206, Logunov, 2001a: 281.

Gen. Hasarius Simon, 1871 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02979] Detail
type Attus adansoni Audouin, 1826; gender masculine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Jacobia Schmidt, 1956e: 150, type J. brauni Schmidt, 1956 by Clark & Benoit, 1977: 102, of Tachyskarthmos Hogg, 1922 by Prószyński, 1984a: 107 and Żabka, 1985: 226, and of Vitioides Marples, 1989 (replacement name provided by Marples, in Platnick, 1989: 636 for Vitia Marples, 1957: 390, type V. albipalpis Marples, 1957, preoccupied) by Prószyński, 1990: 359; not a senior synonym of Rhondes Simon, 1901 (Maddison, Bodner & Needham, 2008: 55, contra Żabka, 1988: 423).
Transferred to other genera:
Hasarius berlandi Lessert, 1925 -- see Hasarinella
Hasarius biprocessiger Lessert, 1927 -- see Plexippoides
Hasarius coelestis Karsch, 1880 -- see Thiania
Hasarius crinitus Karsch, 1879 -- see Carrhotus
Hasarius crucifer Dönitz & Strand, 1906 -- see Phintella
Hasarius dactyloides (Xie, Peng & Kim, 1993) -- see Chinattus
Hasarius dispalans Thorell, 1892 -- see Cytaea
Hasarius doenitzi Karsch, 1879 -- see Plexippoides
Hasarius fulvus L. Koch, 1878 -- see Menemerus
Hasarius lamperti (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) -- see Evarcha
Hasarius mccooki Thorell, 1892 -- see Megafreya
Hasarius neocaledonicus (Simon, 1889) -- see Rhondes
Hasarius patagiatus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Evarcha
Hasarius punctiventer Karsch, 1881 -- see Thyene
Hasarius roeweri Lessert, 1925 -- see Hasarinella
Hasarius simonis Thorell, 1891 -- see Evarcha
Hasarius sobarus Thorell, 1890 -- see Emathis
Hasarius varicans (Thorell, 1881) -- see Zenodorus
Hasarius villosus Keyserling, 1881 -- see Servaea
Hasarius vittatus Keyserling, 1881 -- see Maratus
In synonymy:
Hasarius albipalpis (Marples, 1957) = Hasarius adansoni (Audouin, 1826) (Prószyński, 1990: 359).
Hasarius albocircumdatus (L. Koch, 1880) = Hasarius adansoni (Audouin, 1826) (Żabka, 1991c: 29).
Hasarius annamensis (Hogg, 1922) = Hasarius adansoni (Audouin, 1826) (Prószyński, 1984a: 107, Żabka, 1985: 226).
Hasarius brauni (Schmidt, 1956) = Hasarius adansoni (Audouin, 1826) (Clark & Benoit, 1977: 102).
Hasarius fusca (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901, T from Phiale) = Hasarius adansoni (Audouin, 1826) (Galiano, 1981f: 283).
Hasarius longipalpis (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906, T from Evarcha) = Hasarius adansoni (Audouin, 1826) (Prószyński, 1984a: 58, 172).
Hasarius nigriceps (Taczanowski, 1879, T from Euophrys) = Hasarius adansoni (Audouin, 1826) (Galiano, 1979c: 33).
Hasarius picturata (Karsch, 1898, T from Cyrba) = Hasarius adansoni (Audouin, 1826) (Wanless in Prószyński, 1983b: Errata added to p. 297, Wanless, 1984b: 471).
Nomen dubium:
Hasarius arcigerus Karsch, 1892: 302 (Sri Lanka) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1523.

Gen. Helicius Żabka, 1981 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02980] Detail
N.B.: as indicated by Brignoli, this generic name, as used by Prószyński, 1976: 16, was a nomen nudum; as comments approaching a diagnosis were published by Żabka, 1981b: 38, the name is attributed here to that author: H. Żabka, 1981b: 38, type Telamonia cylindrata (Karsch, 1879).

Gen. Heliophanus C. L. Koch, 1833 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02983] Detail
type Aranea cuprea Walckenaer, 1802; gender masculine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Trapezocephalus Berland & Millot, 1941 by Wesolowska, 1986: 5.
Transferred to other genera:
Heliophanus clarus Peckham & Peckham, 1903 -- see Phintella
Heliophanus geminus Song & Chai, 1992 -- see Chinattus
Heliophanus ghesquieri Giltay, 1935 -- see Pseudicius

Heliophanus undulatus Song & Chai, 1992 -- see Chinattus
In synonymy:

Gen. Helvetia Peckham & Peckham, 1894 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02985] Detail
type Helvetia santarema Peckham & Peckham, 1894; gender feminine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Deloripa Simon, 1901 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02919] by Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008b: 140.
Transferred to other genera:
Helvetia canescens (Mello-Leitão, 1944) -- see Menemerus
In synonymy:
Helvetia insularis (Banks, 1902) = Helvetia albovittata Simon, 1901 (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008b: 142).
Helvetia otiosa Galiano, 1976 = Helvetia albovittata Simon, 1901 (Galiano, 1989a: 49, sub H. insularis).
Helvetia quadrifasciata (Mello-Leitão, 1945, T from Deloripa) = Helvetia cancrimana (Taczanowski, 1872) (Galiano, 1963b: 3, sub H. zonata).
Helvetia zebrina Simon, 1901 = Helvetia cancrimana (Taczanowski, 1872) (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008b: 140).
Helvetia zonata Simon, 1901 = Helvetia cancrimana (Taczanowski, 1872) (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008b: 140).

Gen. Hispo Simon, 1886 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02989] Detail
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Astaenorchestes Simon, 1900 and Pseudomarengo Caporiacco, 1947 by Wanless, 1981a: 179 and of Quekettia Peckham & Peckham, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03191] by Wesolowska & Cumming, 2008: 186.
Transferred to other genera:
Hispo alboguttata Simon, 1903 -- see Jerzego
Hispo bipartita Simon, 1903 -- see Jerzego
In synonymy:
Hispo inermis (Caporiacco, 1947) = Hispo georgius (Peckham & Peckham, 1892) (Wesołowska & Cumming, 2008: 186, with inverted priority).
Hispo rufescens (Caporiacco, 1947) = Hispo georgius (Peckham & Peckham, 1892) (Prószyński, 1987: 83, 165).
Nomen dubium:
Hispo continentalis (Caporiacco, 1949a: 462, j, Kenya, originally in Astaenorchestes) -- Wanless, 1981a: 197.

Gen. Hyllus C. L. Koch, 1846 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02997] Detail
type Hyllus giganteus C. L. Koch, 1846; gender masculine
Transferred to other genera:
Hyllus audax Rainbow, 1897 -- see Ascyltus
Hyllus aurantiacus Simon, 1902 -- see Thyenula
Hyllus carbonarius Lessert, 1927 -- see Evarcha
Hyllus cothurnatus (Gerstäcker, 1873) -- see Holcolaetis
Hyllus dubius (Wesolowska, 1989) -- see Wesolowskana
Hyllus ferox Rainbow, 1897 -- see Ascyltus
Hyllus fischeri Bösenberg & Strand, 1906 -- see Evarcha
Hyllus insularis Metzner, 1999 -- see Evarcha
Hyllus lamperti Bösenberg & Strand, 1906 -- see Evarcha
Hyllus mimus Chamberlin, 1924 -- see Plexippus
Hyllus thorelli Simon, 1899 -- see Pancorius
In synonymy:
Hyllus bevisi Lessert, 1925 = Hyllus treleaveni Peckham & Peckham, 1902 (Wesołowska & Cumming, 2004: 579).
Hyllus brevitarsis peckhamorum Berland & Millot, 1941 = Hyllus brevitarsis Simon, 1902 (Wesołowska, 2008: 323).
Hyllus cara (Wesołowska & van Harten, 1994, T from Evarcha) = Hyllus dotatus (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Logunov, 2004d: 87).
Hyllus corniger Wesołowska & van Harten, 1994 = Hyllus dotatus (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Wesołowska & Russell-Smith, 2000: 23, sub Evarcha).
Hyllus damarensis (Lawrence, 1927, T from Thyene) = Hyllus dotatus (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Azarkina & Foord, 2013: 175).
Hyllus guineensis Berland & Millot, 1941 = Hyllus africanus Lessert, 1927 (Wesołowska, 2008: 321).
Hyllus indicus (Tikader, 1974, T from Phidippus) = Hyllus semicupreus (Simon, 1885) (Prószyński, 1990: 272).
Hyllus janthinus (C. L. Koch, 1846) = Hyllus diardi (Walckenaer, 1837) (Xiong, Liu & Zhang, 2017: 24).
Hyllus lacertosus (C. L. Koch, 1846) = Hyllus diardi (Walckenaer, 1837) (Xiong, Liu & Zhang, 2017: 24).
Hyllus lawrencei (Lessert, 1927, T from Viciria) = Hyllus plexippoides Simon, 1906 (Clark, 1974: 18).
Hyllus marleyi Lessert, 1925 = Hyllus treleaveni Peckham & Peckham, 1902 (Wesołowska & Cumming, 2004: 579).
Hyllus moestus Peckham & Peckham, 1903 = Hyllus treleaveni Peckham & Peckham, 1902 (Wesołowska & Cumming, 2004: 579).
Hyllus natalii Peckham & Peckham, 1903 = Hyllus brevitarsis Simon, 1902 (Clark, 1974: 17).
Hyllus normanae Wanless & Clark, 1975 = Hyllus treleaveni Peckham & Peckham, 1902 (Wesołowska, 2008: 333).
Hyllus perspicuus Peckham & Peckham, 1903 = Hyllus argyrotoxus Simon, 1902 (Clark, 1974: 16).
Hyllus rubrotinctus Strand, 1906 = Hyllus brevitarsis Simon, 1902 (Bacelar, 1953: 6).
Hyllus ventrilineatus Strand, 1906 = Hyllus dotatus (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Clark, 1974: 17).

Gen. Hypaeus Simon, 1900 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02998] Detail
type Acragas taczanowskii Mello-Leitão, 1948; gender masculine
N.B.: original type species (Attus porcatus Taczanowski, 1871) changed to Acragas taczanowskii Mello-Leitão, 1948 by ICZN, 1969 (Opinion 889, see Galiano, 1966c); considered a senior synonym of Dasyophrys Mello-Leitão, 1930 and Lyssomonea Chamberlin & Ivie, 1936 (removed from the synonymy of Amycus C. L. Koch, 1846) by Galiano, 1968c: 324.
Transferred to other genera:
Hypaeus catharinensis Mello-Leitão, 1927 -- see Noegus
Hypaeus petropolis Mello-Leitão, 1943 -- see Vinnius
In synonymy:
Hypaeus bivittatus Caporiacco, 1947 = Hypaeus barromachadoi Caporiacco, 1947 (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2008c: 488).
Hypaeus budoninus (Caporiacco, 1954) = Hypaeus taczanowskii (Mello-Leitão, 1948) (Galiano, 1968c: 330, T from Mago).
Hypaeus niger (Mello-Leitão, 1930) = Hypaeus frontosus Simon, 1900 (Galiano, 1968c: 324, T from Dasyophrys).
Hypaeus nudus (Mello-Leitão, 1940) = Hypaeus miles Simon, 1900 (Galiano, 1968c: 325, T from Noegus).
Hypaeus vividus Simon, 1900 = Hypaeus triplagiatus Simon, 1900 (Galiano, 1963a: 377).
Nomina dubia:
Hypaeus furcifer Simon, 1900d: 48 (m, Brazil) -- Galiano, 1963a: 370, 1968c: 318.
Hypaeus tenuimanus Simon, 1900d: 42 (m, Brazil) -- Galiano, 1963a: 374, 1968c: 318.

Gen. Hypoblemum Peckham & Peckham, 1886 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02999] Detail
type Acmaea villosa Keyserling, 1883, syn. of Cytaea grisea Keyserling, 1882
N.B.: Hypoblemum is a replacement name for Drepanephora Keyserling, 1883, which itself is a replacement name of Acmaea  Keyserling, 1882, both preoccupied.
In synonymy:
Hypoblemum albovittatum (Keyserling, 1882) = Hypoblemum scutulatum (L. Koch, 1881) (Otto, Hill & Whyte, 2019: 36).
Hypoblemum dialeucum (L. Koch, 1881) = Hypoblemum scutulatum (L. Koch, 1881) (Otto, Hill & Whyte, 2019: 36, T from Maratus).
Hypoblemum karschi (Żabka, 1987) = Hypoblemum scutulatum (L. Koch, 1881) (Otto, Hill & Whyte, 2019: 36, T from Maratus).
Hypoblemum villosum (Keyserling, 1883) = Hypoblemum griseum (Keyserling, 1882) (Otto, Hill & Whyte, 2019: 4, T from Maratus).

Hypoblemum villosum Peckham & Peckham, 1886: 326.

Hypoblemum albovittatum Żabka & Pollard, 2002b: 65, f. 1-15 (m, Df) [misidentified per Otto, Hill & Whyte, 2019: 4].
Hypoblemum albovittatum Paquin, Vink & Dupérré, 2010: 73, f. 44.6-8 (mf) [misidentified per Otto, Hill & Whyte, 2019: 4].
Hypoblemum albovittatum Prószyński, 2017b: 83, f. 33S, 37A (mf) [misidentified per Otto, Hill & Whyte, 2019: 4].
Hypoblemum griseum Otto, Hill & Whyte, 2019: 4, f. 2.1-3, 3-33 (mf, T from Maratus, S of Hypoblemum villosum).

Gen. Iberattus Prószyński, 2018 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04463] Detail
type Attus semiglabratus Simon, 1868; gender supposedly masculine
N.B.: See the notes by Marusik & Blick, 2019: 91 for problems with the separation of this genus from Euophrys.

Habrocestum semiglabratum Prószyński, 2009a: 320, f. 62 (f, no justification provided for any generic transfer).
Euophrys semiglabrata Barrientos et al., 2014: 36, f. 15-17 (mf).
Euophrys semiglabrata Lecigne, 2017: 34, f. 10G-I (m).

Iberattus semiglabratus Breitling, 2020: 355, f. 29H (m).
Gen. Icius Simon, 1876 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03000] Detail
type Icelus notabilis C. L. Koch, 1846; gender masculine; syn. of Icius hamatus (C. L. Koch, 1846)
N.B.: type species is I. notabilis (C. L. Koch, 1846), which = I. hamatus (C. L. Koch, 1846, not the I. notabilis of Simon, 1871, which is a misidentification of I. subinermis Simon, 1937 (Prószyński, 1983a: 46); considered a senior synonym of Pseudicius Simon, 1885 by Andreeva, Heciak & Prószyński, 1984: 350, but evidence presented by Maddison, 1987: 103, makes this synonymy dubious, and Prószyński, 1987: 151, 164, now considers that they "should be considered separate genera."
Transferred to other genera:
Icius abnormis (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) -- see Phintella
Icius afghanicus Andreeva, Heciak & Prószyński, 1984 -- see Pseudicius
Icius annectans Chamberlin, 1929 -- see Metaphidippus
Icius castriesianus (Grube, 1861) -- see Phintella
Icius cavaleriei (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Phintella
Icius cinctipes Banks, 1900 -- see Attidops
Icius cornutus Peckham & Peckham, 1885 -- see Padilla
Icius daisetsuzanus Saito, 1934 -- see Sittisax
Icius davidi (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Phintelloides
Icius decempunctatus Caporiacco, 1941 -- see Heliophanus
Icius difficilis (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) -- see Phintella
Icius elongatus Karsch, 1879 -- see Mendoza
Icius exornatus Peckham & Peckham, 1909 -- see Messua

Gen. Jollas Simon, 1901 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03011] Detail
type Jollas geniculatus Simon, 1901; gender masculine
N.B.: Considered a senior synonym of Oningis Simon, 1901 (Galiano, 1991b: 20, by transfer of its type species, Neon pompatus Peckham & Peckham, 1893, apparently misidentified by Simon). Prószyński, 2017:  40 placed three species in the genus "Oningis", but without its type species Oningis pompatus.
In synonymy:
Jollas armatus (Caporiacco, 1947, T from Neon) = Jollas geniculatus Simon, 1901 (Galiano, 1991b: 18).
Jollas minutus Chickering, 1946 = Jollas pompatus (Peckham & Peckham, 1894) (Galiano, 1991b: 19).
Jollas peritas Banks, 1929 = Jollas geniculatus Simon, 1901 (Galiano, 1991b: 18).
Nomen dubium:
Jollas lahorensis (Dyal, 1935: 227, f, Pakistan, originally in Oningis) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:034143] -- Prószyński, 2017a: 40, sub "Oningis".

Gen. Laufeia Simon, 1889 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03022] Detail
type Laufeia aenea Simon, 1889; gender feminine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Orcevia Thorell, 1890: 166, type Orcevia keyserlingi Thorell, 1890  [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04200] (contra Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2012: 50), of Junxattus Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2012: 40, type Junxattus daiqini Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2012 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04053] by Zhang & Maddison, 2015: 30 and of Lechia, type Lechia squamata Żabka, 1985 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03024] by transfer of the type species by Logunov & Jäger, 2015: 356. All three genera (Lechia, Junxattus, Orcevia) revalidated by Prószyński, 2019: 122.
Transferred to other genera:
Laufeia daiqini (Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2012) -- see Junxattus
Laufeia eucola (Thorell, 1890) -- see Orcevia
Laufeia keyserlingi (Thorell, 1890) -- see Orcevia
Laufeia kuloni (Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2012) -- see Orcevia

Laufeia minuta (Prószyński, 1992) -- see Lechia
Laufeia perakensis (Simon, 1901) -- see Orcevia

Laufeia scutigera Żabka, 1985 -- see Foliabitus
Laufeia squamata (Żabka, 1985) -- see Lechia

N.B.: considered a synonym of Laufeia Simon, 1889 by transfer of the type species, Lechia squamata, by Logunov & Jäger, 2015: 356, revalidated by Prószyński, 2019: 122.
Lechia minuta (Prószyński, 1992) | f | India     [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:033301]
Euophrys minutus Prószyński, 1992b: 172, f. 30-32 (Df).
Lechia minuta Prószyński, 2017b: 75, f. 32L (f, T from Euophrys, but Lechia not revalidated, therefore assigned to Laufeia, of which Lechia is a synonym).
Lechia minuta Prószyński, 2019: 117 (T from Laufeia, N.B.: only provisionally, belongs neither to Laufeia nor to Euophrys).
Lechia squamata Żabka, 1985 * | m f | China, Vietnam     [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:034225]
Lechia squamata Żabka, 1985: 236, f. 259-262 (Df).

Lechia squamata Song, Zhu & Chen, 1999: 533, f. 302G-H (f).
Laufeia squamata Logunov & Jäger, 2015: 355, f. 33-39 (Dm, f, T from Lechia).
Lechia squamata Prószyński, 2017b: 75, f. 38A1 (mf, T from Laufeia, but Lechia not revalidated).
Lechia squamata Prószyński, 2019: 122, f. 1C, P-Q, Y-Z (mf, T from Laufeia; N.B.: m mismatched and probably misplaced in the genus).
Lechia squamata Peng, 2020: 207, f. 141a-b (f).

Gen. Leptorchestes Thorell, 1870 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03027] Detail
N.B.: not a senior synonym of Kima Peckham & Peckham, 1902 (Wesolowska & Szeremeta, 2001: 220, contra Prószyński's 1984a: 75 S by transfer of type species).
Transferred to other genera:
Leptorchestes reimoseri Lessert, 1927 -- see Kima
In synonymy:
Leptorchestes halogena Metzner, 1999 = Leptorchestes mutilloides (Lucas, 1846) (Wesołowska & Szeremeta, 2001: 233).
Nomina dubia:
Leptorchestes cinctus (Dugès, 1836a: 163, Europe, originally in Salticus) -- Bonnet, 1957: 2399.
Leptorchestes semirufus Simon, 1901g: 74 (Ecuador) -- Wesołowska & Szeremeta, 2001: 238, but see Galiano, 1963a: 384, pl. XXVI, f. 10.

type Ligonipes illustris Karsch, 1878; gender masculine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Discocnemius Thorell, 1881 and Haterius Simon 1900 by Davies & Żabka, 1989: 200; not a senior synonym of Rhombonotus L. Koch, 1879 (Davies & Żabka, 1989: 200) or Ohilimia Strand, 1911 (Gardzińska, 2006: 376, contra Żabka, 1988: 423).

Ligonipes scutellatus (Kritscher, 1959) -- see Ohilimia

Lyssomanes sikkimensis Tikader, 1967 -- see Telamonia
In synonymy:
Lyssomanes banksi Chickering, 1946 = Lyssomanes unicolor (Taczanowski, 1871) (Galiano, 1962b: 89).
Lyssomanes beebei Crane, 1943 = Lyssomanes unicolor (Taczanowski, 1871) (Galiano, 1962b: 89).
Lyssomanes bifasciatus Mello-Leitão, 1917 = Lyssomanes tristis Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 (Galiano, 1980a: 40).
Lyssomanes bradyspilus Crane, 1949 = Lyssomanes quadrinotatus Simon, 1900 (Galiano, 1980a: 46).
Lyssomanes brasiliensis (Mello-Leitão, 1917, T from Chinoscopus) = Lyssomanes tristis Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 (Galiano, 1980a: 40).
Lyssomanes digitatus Galiano, 1962 = Lyssomanes parallelus Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 (Galiano, 1980a: 39).
Lyssomanes dubius Mello-Leitão, 1927 = Lyssomanes tristis Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 (Galiano, 1965a: 132).
Lyssomanes gracilis F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1900 = Lyssomanes remotus Peckham & Peckham, 1896 (Galiano, 1980a: 54).
Lyssomanes lupus Mello-Leitão, 1945 = Lyssomanes leucomelas Mello-Leitão, 1917 (Galiano, 1980a: 22, contra Galiano, 1962b: 77).
Lyssomanes luteus (Walckenaer, 1841, T from Tetragnatha) = Lyssomanes viridis (Walckenaer, 1837) (Ivie, 1967: 126).
Lyssomanes montanus Chickering, 1946 = Lyssomanes consimilis Banks, 1929 (Galiano, 1980a: 34).
Lyssomanes pachygnathus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1900 = Lyssomanes bitaeniatus Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 (Galiano, 1980a: 68).
Lyssomanes pseudobenderi Logunov, 2002 = Lyssomanes benderi Logunov, 2002 (Logunov & Marusik, 2003b: 415).
Lyssomanes quadripunctatus Mello-Leitão, 1917 = Lyssomanes tristis Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 (Galiano, 1965a: 132).
Lyssomanes shropshirei Chickering, 1946 = Lyssomanes unicolor (Taczanowski, 1871) (Galiano, 1980a: 56).
Lyssomanes simplicipes F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1900 = Lyssomanes reductus Peckham & Peckham, 1896 (Galiano, 1980a: 60).
Lyssomanes spinifer F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1900 = Lyssomanes jemineus Peckham, Peckham & Wheeler, 1889 (Galiano, 1980a: 63, after Chickering, 1946).
Lyssomanes wiedenmeyeri Schenkel, 1953 = Lyssomanes elegans F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1900 (Galiano, 1980a: 47).
Lyssomanes zeteki Chickering, 1946 = Lyssomanes elegans F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1900 (Galiano, 1980a: 47).

Gen. Maeota Simon, 1901 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03045] Detail

Gen. Marma Simon, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03059] Detail
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Thysema Mello-Leitão, 1944 and Paralophostica Soares & Camargo, 1948 by Galiano, 1962a: 36.

Gen. Marpissa C. L. Koch, 1846 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03060] Detail
type Araneus muscosus Clerck, 1757; gender feminine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Onondaga Peckham & Peckham, 1909 by Barnes, 1958: 3, of Hyctia Simon, 1876 (itself considered a senior synonym of Icidella Bösenberg & Strand, 1906 by Yaginuma, 1955c: 14) by Harm, 1981: 277, and of Roeweriella Kratochvíl, 1932 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03198] by Logunov, 2009b: 9; not a senior synonym of Mendoza Peckham & Peckham, 1894 (removed from the synonymy of Mithion=Thyene) (Logunov, 1999c: 46, contra Prószyński, 1990: 210).
Transferred to other genera:
Marpissa andamanensis Tikader, 1977 -- see Plexippus
Marpissa anusuae Tikader & Biswas, 1981 -- see Proszynskia
Marpissa arambagensis Biswas & Biswas, 1992 -- see Stenaelurillus

In synonymy:
Marpissa dybowskii (Kulczyński, 1895) = Marpissa milleri (Peckham & Peckham, 1894) (Logunov, 1999c: 38).
Marpissa koreanica Schenkel, 1963 = Marpissa milleri (Peckham & Peckham, 1894) (Wesołowska, 1981b: 138, sub M. dybowskii).
Marpissa magna Kishida, 1910 = Marpissa milleri (Peckham & Peckham, 1894) (Logunov, 1999c: 39).
Marpissa nigrifrontis (Saito, 1939, T from Maevia) = Marpissa milleri (Peckham & Peckham, 1894) (Logunov, 1999c: 39).
Marpissa pratensis (Taczanowski, 1867: 19, T from Dendryphantes, where omitted by both Roewer and Bonnet) = Marpissa radiata (Grube, 1859) (Prószyński & Starega, 1971: 278).
Marpissa roemeri Strand, 1906 = Marpissa milleri (Peckham & Peckham, 1894) (Bohdanowicz & Prószyński, 1987: 77, sub M. dybowskii).
Marpissa wallacei Barnes, 1958 = Marpissa grata (Gertsch, 1936) (Logunov, 1999c: 45).

Gen. Mendoza Peckham & Peckham, 1894 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03067] Detail
type Marpissa canestrinii Ninni, 1868; gender feminine
N.B.: removed from the S of Marpissa C. L. Koch, 1846 by Logunov, 1999c: 46.
Transferred to other genera:
Mendoza carlini Peckham & Peckham, 1903 -- see Menemerus
In synonymy:
Mendoza cognata (Peckham & Peckham, 1894, T from Pseudicius) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Logunov, 1999c: 49).
Mendoza eurina (Simon, 1871, T from Attus=Salticus) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Metzner, 1999: 138).
Mendoza gridellii (Caporiacco, 1934, T from Mithion=Thyene) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Hansen, 1985: 209, sub Marpissa).
Mendoza hiroseae (Nakatsudi, 1942, T from Marpissa) = Mendoza elongata (Karsch, 1879) (Logunov, 1999c: 53).
Mendoza hotingchiehi (Schenkel, 1963, T from Mithion=Thyene) = Mendoza elongata (Karsch, 1879) (Logunov, 1999c: 53, contra Wesolowska, 1981b: 139, who placed it as a junior S of Marpissa nobilis).
Mendoza interrogationis (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906, T from Marpissa) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Yaginuma, 1955c: 14, sub Hyctia magister).
Mendoza magister (Karsch, 1879, T from Marpissa) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Logunov, 1999c: 49).
Mendoza memorabilis (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1876, T from Marpissa) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Logunov, 1999c: 49).
Mendoza mori (Kishida, 1931) = Mendoza elongata (Karsch, 1879) (Ono & Ogata, 2018: 642, T from Sitticus).
Mendoza obscura (Kroneberg, 1875, T from Marpissa) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Logunov & Rakov, 1998: 125, sub Marpissa).
Mendoza pichoni (Schenkel, 1963, T from Mithion=Thyene) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Wesołowska, 1981b: 142, sub Marpissa tschekiangensis).
Mendoza salsophila (Tyschchenko, 1965, T from Marpissa) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Wesołowska, 1981b: 142, sub Marpissa tschekiangensis).
Mendoza tschekiangensis (Schenkel, 1963, T from Mithion = Thyene by Wesołowska, 1981b: 142) = Mendoza canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) (Nenilin, 1984c: 137, sub Marpissa obscura; Hansen, 1985: 209).

Gen. Menemerus Simon, 1868 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03068] Detail
type Euophrys vigorata C. L. Koch, 1846; gender masculine; syn. of Menemerus semilimbatus (Hahn, 1829)
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Camponia Badcock, 1932 by Galiano, 1979c: 33, and of Stridulattus Petrunkevitch, 1926 by Jastrzebski, 1997a: 41 (by S of type species).
Transferred to other genera:
Menemerus acostae Schenkel, 1953 -- see Pachomius
Menemerus banksi Roewer 1951 -- see Terralonus
Menemerus bicruciatus Mello-Leitão, 1943 -- see Breda
Menemerus bracteatus (L. Koch, 1879) -- see Apricia
Menemerus cinctus O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885 -- see Pseudicius
Menemerus clemens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Plexippus
Menemerus crassus Hogg, 1922 -- see Plexippus
Menemerus cruciferus Keyserling, 1885 -- see Anasaitis
Menemerus dabanis Hogg, 1922 -- see Pancorius
Menemerus deletus O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885 -- see Pseudicius
Menemerus devorans (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Plexippus
Menemerus fagei Schenkel, 1963 -- see Heliophanus
Menemerus falconensis Schenkel, 1953 -- see Triggella
Menemerus flavescens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Plexippoides
Menemerus fraternus Banks, 1932 -- see Terralonus
Menemerus frigidus O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885 -- see Pseudicius
Menemerus himeshimensis Dönitz & Strand, 1906 -- see Hakka
Menemerus incertus O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885 -- see Pseudicius
Menemerus indistinctus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Mogrus
Menemerus insolidus Wesolowska, 1999 -- see Icius
Menemerus pullus (Karsch, 1879) -- see Marpissa
Menemerus quadrinotatus Mello-Leitão, 1939 -- see Phiale
Menemerus schutzae Denis, 1961 -- see Phlegra
Menemerus tetralineatus Caporiacco, 1939 -- see Phlegra
Menemerus ursinus Mello-Leitão, 1945 -- see Phiale
Menemerus yunnanensis Schenkel, 1963 -- see Pseudicius
In synonymy:
Menemerus acuminatus Rainbow, 1912 = Menemerus bivittatus (Dufour, 1831) (Richardson, 2016: 528).
Menemerus bonneti Schenkel, 1963 = Menemerus bivittatus (Dufour, 1831) (Wesołowska, 1999: 267).

Menemerus lineatus (Badcock, 1932) = Menemerus bivittatus (Dufour, 1831) (Galiano, 1979c: 33).
Menemerus manicus Wesołowska, 1999 = Menemerus minshullae Wesołowska, 1999 (Wesołowska, 2007a: 520).

Menemerus stridulans (Petrunkevitch, 1926) = Menemerus bivittatus (Dufour, 1831) (Jastrzebski, 1997a: 41).

type Attus taeniola Hentz, 1846; gender feminine
N.B.: removed from the synonymy of Fuentes Peckham & Peckham, 1894 by Barnes, 1958: 29; considered a senior synonym of Parkella Chickering, 1946 by Edwards, 2006: 195.
Transferred to other genera:
Metacyrba arizonensis Barnes, 1958 -- see Platycryptus
Metacyrba californica (Peckham & Peckham, 1888) -- see Platycryptus
Metacyrba nigrosecta (Mello-Leitão, 1945) -- see Balmaceda
Metacyrba undata (De Geer, 1778) -- see Platycryptus

Metacyrba franganilloi (Caporiacco, 1955) = Metacyrba venusta (Chickering, 1946) (Edwards, 2006: 207).
Metacyrba fusca (Chickering, 1946) = Metacyrba venusta (Chickering, 1946) (Edwards, 2006: 207).

Gen. Mexigonus Edwards, 2003 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03541] Detail
M. Edwards, 2003a: 69, type Tylogonus minutus (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901).
In synonymy:
Mexigonus albidus (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901, T from Sidusa) = Mexigonus minutus (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901) (Richman & Cutler, 1978: 101, sub Tylogonus).
Mexigonus belli (Gertsch, 1935, T from Habrocestum) = Mexigonus arizonensis (Banks, 1904) (Richman & Cutler, 1978: 101, sub Tylogonus).
Mexigonus claremonti (Peckham & Peckham, 1909, T from Sitticus) = Mexigonus morosus (Peckham & Peckham, 1888) (Edwards, 1980: 12, sub Tylogonus).
Mexigonus inscriptum (Schenkel, 1951, T from Habrocestum) = Mexigonus morosus (Peckham & Peckham, 1888) (Richman, 1981: 197, sub Tylogonus).

Sidusa arizonensis Banks, 1904a: 116, f. 9 (Df).
Habrocestum belli Gertsch, 1935a: 30, f. 38-39 (Dm).

Tylogonus arizonensis Richman, 1981: 197, f. 1 (m).
Mexigonus arizonensis Edwards, 2003a: 70 (Tmf from Tylogonus).
Mexigonus arizonensis Zhang & Maddison, 2015: 59, f. 250-256 (mf).

Gen. Myrmarachne MacLeay, 1839 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03086] Detail
type Myrmarachne melanocephala MacLeay, 1839; gender feminine
N.B.: Considered a senior synonym of Bizonella Strand, 1929 by Wanless, 1978a: 18 and of Emertonius Peckham & Peckham, 1892 by Wanless, 1978b: 235 (for an alternate view, see Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2010: 162 but also Edwards, 2013a: 4); Emertonius was revalidated by Prószyński, 2018b: 165. For probably available older generic names for the genera splitted from Myrmarachne by Prószyński, 2016 see Edwards, 2013a and Marusik & Blick, 2019: 90. For notes on Indian females, see Prószyński, 1992b: 188, f. 82, 98. On Official List of Generic Names in Zoology (ICZN, 2010: Opinion 2258).

In synonymy:
Myrmarachne abimvai Roewer, 1965 = Myrmarachne elongata Szombathy, 1915 (Wanless, 1978a: 51).
Myrmarachne akermani Lawrence, 1942 = Myrmarachne marshalli Peckham & Peckham, 1903 (Wanless, 1978a: 67).

Gen. Neon Simon, 1876 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03094] Detail
type Salticus reticulatus Blackwall, 1853; gender masculine
Transferred to other genera:
Neon armatus Caporiacco, 1947 -- see Jollas
In synonymy:
Neon fuscostriatus (Grube, 1861, originally in Attus, T from Salticus sub nomen dubium) = Neon reticulatus (Blackwall, 1853) (Marusik, Mikhailov & Omelko, 2015: 120).
Neon kratochvili Miller, 1943 = Neon rayi (Simon, 1875) (Prószyński, 1971e: 442).
Neon obliquus Banks, 1895 (removed from S of N. nellii) = Neon reticulatus (Blackwall, 1853) (Gertsch & Ivie, 1955: 8).
Neon pusio Simon, 1937 = Neon convolutus Denis, 1937 (Logunov, 2004a: 34).
Neon rostratus Seo, 1995 = Neon minutus Żabka, 1985 (Logunov & Marusik, 2001: 148).

Gen. Noegus Simon, 1900 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03097] Detail
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Beccaria Caporiacco, 1947 by Galiano, 1982a: 423 and of Pseudamphidraus Caporiacco, 1947 by Ruiz, Brescovit & Lise, 2007: 380.
Transferred to other genera:
Noegus femellus (Caporiacco, 1955) -- see Marma
Noegus lineatipes (Caporiacco, 1947) -- see Scopocira
Noegus nigromaculatus Mello-Leitão, 1922 -- see Acragas
Noegus nudus Mello-Leitão, 1940 -- see Hypaeus
Noegus patellaris Caporiacco, 1954 -- see Amycus
Noegus variegatus (Caporiacco, 1947) -- see Marma
In synonymy:
Noegus abrahami (Mello-Leitão, 1948, T from Encolpius) = Noegus vulpio Simon, 1900 (Galiano, 1968c: 359).

Gen. Nycerella Galiano, 1982 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03099] Detail
N.B.: replacement name for Cyrene Peckham & Peckham, 1893, preoccupied by Cyrene Lamarck, 1818 (Mollusca, Bivalvia), Cyrene Heckel, 1843 (Pisces) and Cyrene Westwood, 1843 (Insecta, Hemiptera), removed from synonymy of Euophrys C. L. Koch, 1834 by Galiano, 1982b: 54.
In synonymy:
Nycerella albomaculatus (Mello-Leitão, 1939, T from Ilargus) = Nycerella aprica (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Galiano, 1982b: 56).
Nycerella bristowei (Caporiacco, 1948, T from Phiale) = Nycerella aprica (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Galiano, 1982b: 56).
Nycerella curvispina (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901, T from Freya) = Nycerella sanguinea (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Galiano, 1982b: 60).
Nycerella emarginata (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901, T from Freya) = Nycerella sanguinea (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Edwards, 2015).
Nycerella interrupta (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901, T from Phiale) = Nycerella delecta (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Galiano, 1982b: 58).
Nycerella panamae (Chamberlin, 1916, T from Phiale) = Nycerella decorata (Peckham & Peckham, 1894) (Galiano, 1982b: 56).
Nycerella pseudaprica (Caporiacco, 1947, T from Phiale) = Nycerella aprica (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Galiano, 1982b: 56).
Nycerella sanguinea paradoxa (Peckham & Peckham, 1896, originally in Heraclea) = Nycerella sanguinea (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) (Edwards, 2015: 47).

type Ohilimia gracilipes Strand, 1911; gender feminine; syn. of Ohilimia albomaculata (Thorell, 1881)

In synonymy:
Ohilimia bifasciata (Thorell, 1881, T from Diolenius) = Ohilimia albomaculata (Thorell, 1881) (Gardzińska, 2006: 377).

Ohilimia gracilipes Strand, 1911 (T from Discocnemius=Ligonipes) = Ohilimia albomaculata (Thorell, 1881) (Żabka, 1988: 450, sub Discocnemius coccineopilosus).
Ohilimia venusta (Thorell, 1881, T from Diolenius) = Ohilimia albomaculata (Thorell, 1881) (Gardzińska, 2006: 377).

type Attus vulpes Grube, 1861; gender masculine

Gen. Pachomius Peckham & Peckham, 1896 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03112] Detail
N.B.: removed from the synonymy of Phiale C. L. Koch, 1846 by Galiano, 1994a: 214; considered a senior synonym of Aculeobreda Caporiacco, 1955: 443, type A. hadzji Caporiacco, 1955 by Ruiz & Brescovit, 2005b: 754, of Romitia Caporiacco, 1947, type Romitia nigra Caporiacco, 1947  [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03200] and of Uspachus Galiano, 1995b: 122, type U. misionensis Galiano, 1995 (itself considered a junior synonym of Romitia by Ruiz, Brescovit & Lise, 2007: 377) by Edwards, 2015: 51.

N.B. Padillothorax considered a junior synonym of Stagetillus Simon, 1885 by Prószyński, 1987: 104 (by transfer of the type species Padillothorax semiostrinus Simon, 1901); Prószyński, 2017b: 26 revalidated Padillothorax, but not including P. semiostrinus, which was invalid; Prószyński, 2018b: 174 revalidated Padillothorax inclusively its type species.

Gen. Parnaenus Peckham & Peckham, 1896 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03137] Detail
N.B.: usually considered a synonym of Dendryphantes C. L. Koch, 1837, revalidated as subgenus of that genus by Kraus, 1955b: 76, as separate genus by Prószyński, 1971e: 446 and Brignoli, 1983c: 648.
Transferred to other genera:
Parnaenus convexus Chickering, 1946 -- see Bryantella
Parnaenus crassidens (Kraus, 1955) -- see Metaphidippus
Parnaenus fimbriatus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 -- see Metaphidippus
In synonymy:
Parnaenus poecilopus (Caporiacco, 1947, T from Sassacus) = Parnaenus cyanidens (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Scioscia, 1997: 40).
Parnaenus recurvus Chickering, 1946 = Parnaenus cyanidens (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Scioscia, 1997: 40).

Gen. Pelegrina Franganillo, 1930 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03139] Detail
type Pelegrina geniculata Franganillo, 1930, syn. of Pelegrina proxima (Peckham & Peckham, 1901)
In synonymy:
Pelegrina atopodon (Chamberlin, 1925, T from Dendryphantes) = Pelegrina proterva (Walckenaer, 1837) (Kaston, 1973: 117, sub Metaphidippus).
Pelegrina capitata (Hentz, 1845) = Pelegrina proterva (Walckenaer, 1837) (Kaston, 1973: 117, after Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 204, sub Metaphidippus).
Pelegrina crassiventer (Keyserling, 1885, removed from S of P. capitata) = Pelegrina galathea (Walckenaer, 1837) (Maddison, 1996: 263).
Pelegrina digitata (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901, T from Beata) = Pelegrina galathea (Walckenaer, 1837) (Maddison, 1996: 263).
Pelegrina geniculata Franganillo, 1930 = Pelegrina proxima (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Maddison, 1996: 265).
Pelegrina glacialis (Scheffer, 1905) = Pelegrina arizonensis (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Cutler & Jennings, 1985: 3, sub Metaphidippus).
Pelegrina leucophaea (C. L. Koch, 1846, removed from S of P. proterva) = Pelegrina galathea (Walckenaer, 1837) (Maddison, 1996: 263, contra Edwards, 1980: 12; see also Richman & Cutler, 1978: 85).
Pelegrina mima (Chamberlin, 1924, T from Metaphidippus) = Pelegrina furcata (F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901) (Maddison, 1996: 292).
Pelegrina nubilis (Hentz, 1846, T from Dendryphantes) = Pelegrina galathea (Walckenaer, 1837) (Kaston, 1973: 117, sub Metaphidippus).
Pelegrina ornata (Banks, 1892, removed from S of Dendryphantes capitatus) = Pelegrina galathea (Walckenaer, 1837) (Kaston, 1973: 117, sub Metaphidippus).
Pelegrina parva (Hentz, 1846, removed from S of Dendryphantes capitatus) = Pelegrina galathea (Walckenaer, 1837) (Richman & Cutler, 1988: 74, sub Metaphidippus).
Pelegrina prudens (Peckham & Peckham, 1901, T from Metaphidippus) = Pelegrina proxima (Peckham & Peckham, 1901) (Maddison, 1996: 265, after Bryant, 1940).
Pelegrina uteana (Chamberlin & Gertsch, 1929, T from Metaphidippus) = Pelegrina aeneola (Curtis, 1892) (Maddison, 1996: 288).

Gen. Pellenes Simon, 1876 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03140] Detail
type Aranea tripunctata Walckenaer, 1802; gender masculine
N.B.: replacement name for Pales C. L. Koch, 1850: 64 (type Attus crucigerus Walckenaer, 1805 - S of Pellenes tripunctatus (Walckenaer, 1802)), preoccupied in Diptera by Robineau-Desvoidy, 1830; considered a senior synonym of Hyllothyene Caporiacco, 1939 by Prószyński, 1987: 44 (by transfer of type species); not a senior synonym of Evarcha Simon, 1902 or Habronattus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 (Griswold, 1987a: 14, contra Lowrie & Gertsch, 1955: 19); see Prószyński, 2002: 237, f. 75-76 for discussion of a female from Hawaii.
Transferred to other genera:
Pellenes agilis (Banks, 1893) -- see Habronattus

In synonymy:
Pellenes albomaculatus Peng & Xie, 1993 = Pellenes denisi Schenkel, 1963 (Logunov, Marusik & Rakov, 1999: 122).
Pellenes chanujensis Prószyński, 1982 = Pellenes limbatus Kulczyński, 1895 (Logunov, 1992c: 61).
Pellenes kraepelinorum Bösenberg, 1895 = Pellenes geniculatus (Simon, 1868) (Wunderlich, 1987a: 274).
Pellenes kulabicus Andreeva, 1976 = Pellenes geniculatus (Simon, 1868) (Logunov, Marusik & Rakov, 1999: 126).
Pellenes laggani Peckham & Peckham, 1909 = Pellenes ignifrons (Grube, 1861) (Maddison in Prószyński, 1979: 314).
Pellenes montanus (Emerton, 1894) = Pellenes lapponicus (Sundevall, 1833) (Edwards & Jennings, 2010: 1).
Pellenes nigrociliatus bilunulatus Simon, 1877 = Pellenes nigrociliatus (Simon, 1875) (Prószyński, 1971d: 244).
Pellenes ostrinus (Simon, 1868) = Pellenes diagonalis (Simon, 1868) (Cantarella & Alicata, 2002: 575).
Pellenes simoni (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) = Pellenes flavipalpis (Lucas, 1853) (Schäfer, 2020: 83, confirming Metzner, 1999: 127, contra Logunov, Marusik & Rakov, 1999: 126, who regarded it as S of P. geniculatus).
Pellenes tauricus (Thorell, 1875) = Pellenes nigrociliatus (Simon, 1875) (Logunov, Marusik & Rakov, 1999: 132, contra Metzner, 1999: 127, confirmed by Schäfer, 2020: 83).
Pellenes tesin Logunov, 1995 = Pellenes dilutus Logunov, 1995 (Logunov & Rakov, 1998: 126).
Pellenes unispinus (Franganillo, 1910) = Pellenes nigrociliatus (Simon, 1875) (Breitling et al., 2016b: 55, T from Salticus).
Pellenes wrighti Lowrie & Gertsch, 1955 = Pellenes peninsularis Emerton, 1925 (Maddison, 2017: 66).

Pellenes pulcher Wesolowska, 2000 -- see Pellenes tharinae
