Phiale virgo C. L. Koch, 1846 | f | Suriname     [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:035422]
Phiale virgo C. L. Koch, 1846: 196, f. 1244 (Df).
Gen. Phidippus C. L. Koch, 1846 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03152] Detail
type Salticus variegatus Lucas, 1833 (nomen oblitum); gender masculine; syn. of Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845)
N.B.: type species proposed by Levi & Pinter, 1970 (see comments by Beatty & Leech, 1971, Bonnet, 1971 and Edwards & Cutler, 1979 – no decision by the ICZN); genus considered valid (i.e., not a synonym of Dendryphantes C. L. Koch, 1837) by all recent authors (see Edwards, 1977: 21); Indian species probably misplaced.
Transferred to other genera:
Phidippus basalis Banks, 1904 -- see Paraphidippus
Phidippus fulgidus C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Paraphidippus
Phidippus fuscipes (C. L. Koch, 1846) -- see Paraphidippus
Phidippus galathea (Walckenaer, 1837) -- see Pelegrina
Phidippus incontestus Banks, 1909 -- see Paraphidippus
Phidippus indicus Tikader, 1974 -- see Hyllus
Phidippus metallicus C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Parnaenus
Phidippus nitens C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Paraphidippus
Phidippus pateli Tikader, 1974 -- see Telamonia
Phidippus tesselatus C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Gastromicans
In synonymy:
Phidippus abboti Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944 = Phidippus pius Scheffer, 1905 (Edwards, 1977: 21).
Phidippus altanus Gertsch, 1934 = Phidippus borealis Banks, 1895 (Edwards, 1977: 21).
Phidippus auctus C. L. Koch, 1846 = Phidippus insignarius C. L. Koch, 1846 (Edwards, 2004: 52).
Phidippus audax limbatus Franganillo, 1930 = Phidippus regius C. L. Koch, 1846 (Edwards, 2004: 54).
Phidippus aureopilosus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 = Phidippus cardinalis (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 64, after Marx, 1890).
Phidippus bardus Peckham & Peckham, 1901 (removed from S of P. insolens) = Phidippus apacheanus Chamberlin & Gertsch, 1929 (Edwards, 2004: 89, who suppressed the older name for lack of usage).
Phidippus bivittatus (C. L. Koch, 1846, T from Plexippus) = Phidippus cardinalis (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 64, after Marx, 1890).
Phidippus carolinus C. L. Koch, 1846 = Phidippus otiosus (Hentz, 1846) (Edwards, 2004: 56).
Phidippus castrensis C. L. Koch, 1846 = Phidippus princeps (Peckham & Peckham, 1883) (Edwards, 2004: 69, who suppressed the older name for lack of usage).
Phidippus chilamae (Kraus, 1955) = Phidippus bidentatus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 71).
Phidippus coccineus Peckham & Peckham, 1909 = Phidippus californicus Peckham & Peckham, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 57).
Phidippus coloradensis Thorell, 1877 (T from Dendryphantes) = Phidippus clarus Keyserling, 1885 (Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95).
Phidippus deceptus (Petrunkevitch, 1911) = Phidippus georgii Peckham & Peckham, 1896 (Edwards, 2004: 27).
Phidippus diabolus (Kraus, 1955) = Phidippus pius Scheffer, 1905 (Edwards, 2004: 59).
Phidippus dorsalis Bryant, 1942 = Phidippus otiosus (Hentz, 1846) (Edwards, 2004: 56).
Phidippus electus C. L. Koch, 1846 (removed from S of P. mystaceus) = Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 73).
Phidippus farneus (Peckham & Peckham, 1888) = Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 73).
Phidippus femoratus Peckham & Peckham, 1909 = Phidippus comatus Peckham & Peckham, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 31).
Phidippus ferrugineus Scheffer, 1904 = Phidippus apacheanus Chamberlin & Gertsch, 1929 (Edwards, 1977: 21, but older name suppressed for lack of usage by Edwards, 2004: 89).
Phidippus flavus (Peckham & Peckham, 1883, T from Salticus) = Phidippus clarus Keyserling, 1885 (Edwards, 2004: 60, who suppressed the older name for lack of usage).
Phidippus foveolatus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 = Phidippus bidentatus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 71).
Phidippus hirsutus Barrows, 1919 = Phidippus mystaceus (Hentz, 1846) (Edwards in Richman & Cutler, 1978: 96).
Phidippus howardi Peckham & Peckham, 1896 = Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 74).
Phidippus insolens (Hentz, 1845) = Phidippus princeps (Peckham & Peckham, 1883) (Edwards, 2004: 69, who suppressed the older name for lack of usage).
Phidippus kaibabensis Gertsch, 1934 = Phidippus tyrrelli Peckham & Peckham, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 46).
Phidippus lyratus (Kraus, 1955) = Phidippus bidentatus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 71).
Phidippus mccooki (Peckham & Peckham, 1883) = Phidippus cardinalis (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 64).
Phidippus mexicanus Peckham & Peckham, 1888 = Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 73).
Phidippus miniatus (Peckham & Peckham, 1883) = Phidippus regius C. L. Koch, 1846 (Richman, 1977: 10).
Phidippus modestus (C. L. Koch, 1846, removed from S of P. cardinalis) = Phidippus whitmani Peckham & Peckham, 1909 (Edwards, 2004: 79, who suppressed the older name for lack of usage).
Phidippus montivagus Peckham & Peckham, 1901 (removed from S of P. tyrelli) = Phidippus carneus Peckham & Peckham, 1896 (Edwards, 2004: 46).
Phidippus obscurus Peckham & Peckham, 1888 = Phidippus arizonensis (Peckham & Peckham, 1883) (Edwards, 2004: 40).
Phidippus opifex (McCook, 1883) = Phidippus octopunctatus (Peckham & Peckham, 1883) (Richman & Cutler, 1978: 96).
Phidippus paludatus C. L. Koch, 1846 (removed from S of P. cardinalis) = Phidippus whitmani Peckham & Peckham, 1909 (Edwards, 2004: 79, who suppressed the older name for lack of usage).
Phidippus peritus Gertsch, 1934 = Phidippus texanus Banks, 1906 (Edwards, 1977: 21).
Phidippus pix Pinter, 1970 = Phidippus cruentus F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 39).
Phidippus pogonopus Chamberlin, 1925 = Phidippus tyrrelli Peckham & Peckham, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 46).
Phidippus pulcher (Walckenaer, 1837) = Phidippus otiosus (Hentz, 1846) (Richman, 1978: 58, but younger name subsequently conserved by ICZN, 1985).
Phidippus purpurifer C. L. Koch, 1846 (removed from S of P. audax) = Phidippus regius C. L. Koch, 1846 (Edwards, 2004: 54).
Phidippus rauterbergi Peckham & Peckham, 1888 = Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 73, after Banks, 1916).
Phidippus reederi Gertsch & Riechert, 1976 = Phidippus carneus Peckham & Peckham, 1896 (Edwards, 2004: 46).
Phidippus rufus (Hentz, 1846, T from Salticus) = Phidippus cardinalis (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 64).
Phidippus severus (Thorell, 1891, T from Dendryphantes) = Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 74).
Phidippus testaceus C. L. Koch, 1846 = Phidippus clarus Keyserling, 1885 (Edwards, 2004: 60, who suppressed the older name for lack of usage).
Phidippus togatus C. L. Koch, 1846 (removed from S of P. regius) = Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) (Edwards, 2004: 73).
Phidippus tullgreni Wallace, 1950 = Phidippus regius C. L. Koch, 1846 (Edwards, 2004: 54).
Phidippus variegatus (Lucas, 1833) = Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) (Richman, 1977: 10, older name suppressed because of lack of usage).
Phidippus volcanus Gertsch & Riechert, 1976 = Phidippus pius Scheffer, 1905 (Edwards, 2004: 59).
Phidippus xeros Edwards, 1978 = Phidippus workmani Peckham & Peckham, 1901 (Edwards, 2004: 77).
Nomina dubia:
Phidippus arrogans C. L. Koch, 1846: 157, f. 1212 (j, Brazil) -- Edwards, 2004: 4.
Phidippus cinereus (Walckenaer, 1837: 440, f, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 207, f. 37, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95.
Phidippus contemplator (Walckenaer, 1837: 457, USA, originally in Attus, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1213, (sub P. obscurus).
Phidippus dissimulator (Walckenaer, 1837: 453, f, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 207, f. 19, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95.
Phidippus excubitor (Walckenaer, 1805: 23, 1837: 436, mf, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 207, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95.
Phidippus formosus (Peckham & Peckham, 1883: 23, pl. 2, f. 18, originally in Attus, f, USA) -- Edwards, 2004: 61, contra Richman & Cutler, 1978: 96 (N.B.: preoccupied in Phidippus by a fossil and therefore renamed P. homarinus by Cockerell, 1924).
Phidippus fraudulentus (Walckenaer, 1837: 442, f, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 208, removed from S of Dendryphantes insignatrius per Roewer) -- Richman, 1978: 58.
Phidippus insidiosus (Walckenaer, 1837: 440, mf, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 208, f. 217, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95.
Phidippus investigator (Walckenaer, 1837: 445, m, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 208, f. 18, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95.
Phidippus latus (Walckenaer, 1837: 438, f, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 209, f. 15, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95.
Phidippus pileatus (Walckenaer, 1837: 450, f, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 210, f. 17, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95.
Phidippus pilosus (Walckenaer, 1837: 447, m, USA, originally in Attus, T here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 211, f. 33, T from Dendryphantes per Roewer) -- Richman & Cutler, 1978: 95.

Phidippus rimator (Walckenaer, 1837: 446, f, f, USA, originally in Attus, T to Philaeus by Peckham & Peckham, 1888: 32, pl. 1, f. 22, here by Chamberlin & Ivie, 1944: 212, removed from S of Dendryphantes clarus per Roewer) -- Richman, 1978: 58, Edwards, 2004: 60.

Phidippus audax (Hentz, 1845) * | m f | North America. Introduced to Hawaii, Azores, Netherlands, India (Nicobar Is.)     [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:035430]

Gen. Philaeus Thorell, 1869 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03153] Detail
type Aranea chrysops Poda, 1761; gender masculine
N.B.: replacement name for Philia C. L. Koch, 1846: vol. 13: 54, preoccupied in Hemiptera by Schiödte, 1842.
Transferred to other genera:
Philaeus bulbosus Karsch, 1880 -- see Eris
Philaeus dumicola (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) -- see Mogrus
Philaeus maoniuensis Liu, Wang & Peng, 1991 -- see Yllenus
Philaeus mathisi Berland & Millot, 1941 -- see Mogrus
Philaeus pacificus Banks, 1902 -- see Cerionesta
Philaeus pallidus Mello-Leitão, 1948 -- see Chira
Philaeus senilis Denis, 1955 -- see Mogrus
Philaeus superciliosus Bertkau, 1883 -- see Sandalodes
Philaeus varicus (Simon, 1868) -- see Carrhotus
In synonymy:
Philaeus albovariegatus (Simon, 1868) = Philaeus chrysops (Poda, 1761) (Breitling et al., 2016b: 65).
Philaeus bilineatus (Walckenaer, 1825) = Philaeus chrysops (Poda, 1761) (Prószyński, 1971d: 249).
Philaeus lanipes (C. L. Koch, 1846) = Philaeus chrysops (Poda, 1761) (Breitling et al., 2016b: 63).
Nomina dubia:
Philaeus jugatus (L. Koch, 1856: 408, f, Spain, originally in Dendryphantes) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:035512] -- Breitling et al., 2016b: 65.
Philaeus quadrifasciatus (Grube, 1861: 175, f, Russia, originally in Attus) -- Prószyński, 1971c: 206, Logunov & Marusik, 2001: 258.

Gen. Phintella Strand, 1906 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03154] Detail
type Phintella typica Strand, 1906 (in Bösenberg & Strand); gender feminine; syn. of Telamonia bifurcilinea Bösenberg & Strand, 1906
Transferred to other genera:
Phintella albiocciput (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) -- see Phintelloides
Phintella alboterminus Caleb, 2014 -- see Icius
Phintella caprina (Simon, 1903) -- see Telamonia
Phintella davidi (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Phintelloides
Phintella diatreta (Simon, 1902) -- see Proszynskia
Phintella dimorphus (Dönitz & Strand, 1906) -- see Phintelloides
Phintella guineensis Wesolowska & Wiśniewski, 2013 -- see Chrysilla
Phintella micans Caporiacco, 1935 -- see Chalcoscirtus
Phintella munita (Strand, 1907) -- see Phintelloides
Phintella munita (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) -- see Phintelloides
Phintella mussooriensis Prószyński, 1992 -- see Nandicius
Phintella tibialis Żabka, 1985 -- see Chinattus
Phintella tschekiangensis (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Phintelloides
Phintella versicolor (C. L. Koch, 1846) -- see Phintelloides
Phintella volupe (Karsch, 1879) -- see Chrysilla
In synonymy:
Phintella aequipes longirostris (Lessert, 1925, T from Telamonia) = Phintella aequipes (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Prószyński, 1984a: 106).
Phintella aninotata (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906, T from Euophrys) = Phintella castriesiana (Grube, 1861) (Prószyński, 1983a: 46).
Phintella bilineata (Saito, 1939, T from Sitticus) = Phintella castriesiana (Grube, 1861) (Prószyński, 1971c: 207, sub Attus arenicolor, contra Yaginuma, 1970d: 671, sub Jotus linea).
Phintella clara (Peckham & Peckham, 1903, T from Heliophanus) = Phintella aequipes (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Wesołowska & Cumming, 2008: 203).
Phintella crucifer (Dönitz & Strand 1906, T from Hasarius, where "nicht zu deuten" per Roewer) = Phintella bifurcilinea (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) (Paik, 1978e: 443, sub Telamonia).
Phintella difficilis (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) = Phintella arenicolor (Grube, 1861) (Prószyński, 1987: 151, 161, P. mellotteei).
Phintella lesserti (Schenkel, 1963, T from Dexippus) = Phintella arenicolor (Grube, 1861) (Yin & Wang, 1979: 31, sub Jotus difficilis).
Phintella lucai Żabka, 1985 = Phintella aequipeiformis Żabka, 1985 (Luong, Yamasaki & Eguchi, 2016: 286).
Phintella mellotteei (Simon, 1888) = Phintella arenicolor (Grube, 1861) (Logunov & Wesołowska, 1992: 135).
Phintella pallicolor (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906, T from Sitticus) = Phintella arenicolor (Grube, 1861) (Prószyński, 1987: 161, 168, P. mellotteei).
Phintella pupus (Karsch, 1879, T from Icius) = Phintella bifurcilinea (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) (Yaginuma, 1986a: 232, after Prószyński, 1983b: 5, 7).
Phintella ranjita (Tikader, 1967, T from Salticus) = Phintella vittata (C. L. Koch, 1846) (Prószyński, 1990: 281).
Phintella solers (Peckham & Peckham, 1903, T from Pochyta) = Phintella aequipes (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Wesołowska, 2012b: 332).
Phintella typica Strand, 1906 = Phintella bifurcilinea (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906) (Prószyński, 1983b: 7).

Gen. Plexippoides Prószyński, 1984 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03162] Detail
type Yllenus starmuehlneri Roewer, 1955; gender masculine
N.B.: generic name originally published by Prószyński, 1976: 17, remained a nomen nudum until a diagnosis was provided by Prószyński, 1984b: 399; possibly a junior synonym of Epeus Peckham & Peckham, 1885 (Żabka, 1985: 214); considered a senior synonym of Menemerops Prószyński, 1992a: 99, type Menemerus flavescens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) by Wesołowska, 1996: 34.
Transferred to other genera:
Plexippoides bicuspidatus Song, Gu & Chen, 1988 -- see Epeus
In synonymy:
Plexippoides afghanus (Roewer, 1962) = Plexippoides flavescens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) (Logunov & Zamanpoore, 2005: 225).
Plexippoides arabicus Prószyński, 1989 = Plexippoides flavescens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) (Logunov & Zamanpoore, 2005: 225, after Wesolowska, 1996: 34, contra Prószyński, 2003: 138).
Plexippoides joopili Kim & Yoo, 1997 = Plexippoides regius Wesołowska, 1981 (Namkung, Kim & Lee, 2000: 336, 338).
Plexippoides sollistimus (Wesołowska & van Harten, 1994) = Plexippoides flavescens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) (Prószyński, 2003: 138, sub P. arabicus, contra Wesolowska, 1996: 35, who placed the name as a junior S of P. flavescens).
Plexippoides starmuehlneri (Roewer, 1955) = Plexippoides flavescens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872) (Logunov & Zamanpoore, 2005: 225).

Gen. Plexippus C. L. Koch, 1846 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03163] Detail
type Plexippus ligo C. L. Koch, 1846; gender masculine; syn. of Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826)
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Hissarinus Charitonov, 1951: 215, type H. kondarensis Charitonov, 1951 by Andreeva, 1975: 339 (by transfer of type species), and of Apamamia Roewer, 1944 by Ledoux & Hallé, 1995: 12.
Transferred to other genera:
Plexippus albicrinitus Badcock, 1932 -- see Euophrys
Plexippus albopunctatus Thorell, 1895 -- see Burmattus
Plexippus annulipedis Saito, 1939 -- see Plexippoides
Plexippus argentosus Thorell, 1881 -- see Cytaea
Plexippus bivittatus C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Phidippus
Plexippus caeruleus Karsch, 1880 -- see Chalcotropis
Plexippus calcaratus Karsch, 1880 -- see Epocilla
Plexippus crassipes Karsch, 1881 -- see Pancorius
Plexippus discifer Schenkel, 1953 -- see Plexippoides
Plexippus fannae (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) -- see Freya
Plexippus gajbei Karthikeyani & Kannan, 2013 -- see Carrhotus
Plexippus guttatus C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Phiale
Plexippus incanus Karsch, 1878 -- see Servaea
Plexippus intermedius Karsch, 1880 -- see Bavia
Plexippus kuekenthali Pocock, 1897 -- see Pristobaeus
Plexippus lividus Karsch, 1880 -- see Telamonia
Plexippus luteostriatus (Keyserling, 1877) -- see Euophrys
Plexippus marginellus (Simon, 1883) -- see Wesolowskana
Plexippus musicus Mello-Leitão, 1945 -- see Tullgrenella
Plexippus nigrifrons C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Evarcha
Plexippus optabilis Fox, 1937 -- see Evarcha
Plexippus planiceps Karsch, 1880 -- see Bavia
Plexippus pococki Thorell, 1895 -- see Burmattus
Plexippus pseudopaykulli Sen, Dhali, Saha & Raychaudhuri, 2015 -- see Pancorius
Plexippus pupulus Thorell, 1881 -- see Omoedus
Plexippus rufus C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Eris
Plexippus selectus C. L. Koch, 1846 -- see Phiale
Plexippus setosus Karsch, 1880 -- see Telamonia
Plexippus severus Thorell, 1881 -- see Cytaea
Plexippus simplicissimus Karsch, 1880 -- see Thiania
Plexippus unicolor Karsch, 1880 -- see Lepidemathis
Plexippus validus Urquhart, 1893 -- see Servaea
Plexippus wallacei Thorell, 1881 -- see Euryattus
In synonymy:
Plexippus bengalensis (Tikader, 1974) = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Żabka, 1990b: 170).
Plexippus berlandi (Schenkel, 1963, T from Dexippus) = Plexippus setipes Karsch, 1879 (Prószyński, 1973b: 120).
Plexippus bocki (Roewer, 1944) = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Ledoux & Hallé, 1995: 12).
Plexippus crassus (Hogg, 1922, T from Menemerus) = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Żabka, 1985: 432).
Plexippus magnus (Berland, 1933, T from Sandalodes) = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Berland, 1945: 24).
Plexippus mandali (Tikader, 1974, T from Marpissa) = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Tikader & Biswas, 1981: 100).
Plexippus mimus (Chamberlin, 1924, T from Hyllus) = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Fox, 1937d: 17).
Plexippus planipudens Karsch, 1881 (T from Artabrus) = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Prószyński, 2009b: 162).
Plexippus punctatus Karsch, 1878 = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Żabka, 1985: 432).
Plexippus quadriguttatus Mello-Leitão, 1946 = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Galiano, 1979c: 34).
Plexippus vetusta (C. L. Koch, 1846, T from Euophrys) = Plexippus paykulli (Audouin, 1826) (Prószyński, 2017c: 61).
Plexippus yinae Peng & Li, 2003 = Plexippus tectonicus Prószyński, 2003 (Prószyński, 2017c: 66).
Nomina dubia:
Plexippus hepaticus C. L. Koch, 1846: 109 (Malaysia) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1634.
Plexippus malayensis Simon, 1864: 325 (Malaysia) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1635.
Plexippus obesus Thorell, 1881: 641 (Malaysia) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1635.
Plexippus sylvarus Urquhart, 1892b: 252 (New Zealand) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1635.
Plexippus veles Thorell, 1878b: 251 (Amboina) -- Roewer, 1955c: 1635.

Gen. Pochytoides Wesołowska, 2020 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04446] Detail
type Pochyta (Pochytoides) poissoni Berland & Millot, 1941; gender feminine
N.B. Described as a subgenus of Pochyta by Berland & Millot, 1941: 361, but this description was not valid after ICZN Article 13.3., because no type species was fixed; the subgenus was elevated to genus level by Wesołowska, 2018a: 3; Wesołowska, 2020b: 56 gave the genus the same name, which was formerly a nomen nudum.

Gen. Portia Karsch, 1878 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03169] Detail
type Portia schultzi Karsch, 1878; gender feminine
N.B.: Portia was published in December 1878 (see Wanless, 1978f: 84); Sinis Thorell, 1878b (June): 269 (preoccupied in Coleoptera by Heer 1862) was replaced by Linus Peckham & Peckham, 1886: 264, 289; Portia was considered a senior synonym of Linus (itself considered a senior synonym of Boethoportia Hogg, 1915 by Clark, in Prószyński, 1971e: 385, through synonymy of type species) and Neccocalus Roewer, 1965: 20, type Cocalus africanus Thorell, 1899 by Wanless, 1978f: 84; not a senior synonym of Brettus Thorell, 1895 (Wanless, 1978f: 83).
Transferred to other genera:
Portia adonis (Simon, 1900) -- see Brettus
Portia albolimbata (Simon, 1900) -- see Brettus
Portia cazomboensis Wanless, 1978 -- see Meleon
Portia cingulata (Thorell, 1895) -- see Brettus
Portia durbani Peckham & Peckham, 1903 -- see Veissella
Portia falcifera Wanless, 1978 -- see Meleon
Portia guineensis (Berland & Millot, 1941) -- see Meleon
Portia kenti Lessert, 1925 -- see Meleon
Portia madagascarensis Wanless, 1978 -- see Meleon
Portia oreophila Wanless, 1978 -- see Meleon
Portia russata Simon, 1900 -- see Meleon
Portia solitaria Lessert, 1927 -- see Meleon
In synonymy:
Portia africana (Thorell, 1899) = Portia africana (Simon, 1886) (Wanless, 1978f: 93).
Portia alboguttata (Lawrence, 1938) = Portia schultzi Karsch, 1878 (Murphy & Murphy, 1983a: 37).
Portia alticeps (Pocock, 1898) = Portia fimbriata (Doleschall, 1859) (Wanless, 1978f: 99).
Portia lesserti (Lawrence, 1937) = Portia schultzi Karsch, 1878 (Wanless, 1978f: 88).
Portia ocellata (Hogg, 1915) = Portia fimbriata (Doleschall, 1859) (Clark in Prószyński, 1971e: 385).
Nomina dubia:
Portia deciliata Strand, 1907d: 745 (m, Madagascar) -- Wanless, 1978f: 116.
Portia nigrolineata (Strand, 1908f: 482, j, Madagascar, originally in Linus) -- Wanless, 1978f: 117.
Portia subvexa (Thorell, 1890b: 79, m, Indonesia: Sumatra, originally in Linus) -- Wanless, 1978f: 117, (but see Reimoser, 1925: 90).

Gen. Pseudeuophrys Dahl, 1912 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03181] Detail
type Attus erraticus Walckenaer, 1826; gender feminine
N.B.: removed from the synonymy of Euophrys C. L. Koch, 1834 by Żabka, 1997: 76 and Logunov, 1998b: 111, contra Prószyński, 1962b: 208.
Transferred to other genera:
Pseudeuophrys pallidipes Dobroruka, 2002 -- see Saitis

Pseudeuophrys variegata (Denis, 1957, T from Phlegra) = Pseudeuophrys lanigera (Simon, 1871) (Hęciak & Prószyński, 1984a: 379, sub Euophrys).

Gen. Pseudicius Simon, 1885 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03182] Detail
type Aranea encarpata Walckenaer, 1802; gender masculine
N.B.: see note under Icius; unless approved by subsequent workers, transfers of species to Icius by Andreeva, Heciak & Prószyński, 1984, are not followed here; considered a senior synonym of Savaiia Marples, 1957: 388, type S. punctata Marples, 1957, by Prószyński, 1990: 316; not a senior synonym of Afraflacilla Berland & Millot, 1941 or its junior synonym Flacilloides Denis, 1954 (Żabka, 1993: 280 and Prószyński, 2017b: 43), contra Wanless, 1984c: 76 and Clark, 1974), or of Paramarpissa F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 (Logunov & Cutler, 1999: 1218); synonmy of Spadera Peckham & Peckham, 1894 by Simon, 1901a: 613 rejected by Prószyński, 2017b: 42.
Transferred to other genera:

Gen. Pseudomogrus Simon, 1937 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04494] Detail
type Attus univittatus Simon, 1871
N.B.: Considered a senior synonym of Yllenus Simon, 1868 by Prószyński, 1968d: 415, revalidated and considered a senior synonym of Logunyllus Prószyński, 2016 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04365] (type Attus albocinctus Kroneberg, 1875) by Marusik & Blick, 2019: 89.
In synonymy:
Pseudomogrus arabicus (Prószyński, 1993) = Pseudomogrus saliens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1876) (Logunov & Marusik, 2003a: 63, sub Yllenus).
Pseudomogrus israelensis (Logunov, 1996) = Pseudomogrus tschoni (Caporiacco, 1936) (Logunov & Marusik, 2003a: 72, sub Yllenus).
Pseudomogrus probatus (Wesołowska, 1996) = Pseudomogrus mirandus (Wesołowska, 1996) (Logunov & Marusik, 2003a: 53, sub Yllenus).
Pseudomogrus somonensis (Prószyński, 1982) = Pseudomogrus validus (Simon, 1889) (Logunov & Marusik, 2003a: 77, sub Yllenus).

Gen. Ptocasius Simon, 1885 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03189] Detail
type Ptocasius weyersi Simon, 1885; gender masculine
N.B.: see Prószyński, 2002: 239, f. 79-80 for discussion of a male from Hawaii.
Transferred to other genera:
Ptocasius plumbeiventris (Keyserling, 1881) -- see Cytaea
Ptocasius yunnanensis Song, 1991 -- see Carrhotus
In synonymy:
Ptocasius digitatus (Peng & Li, 2002) = Ptocasius montiformis Song, 1991 (Lin & Li, 2020c: 123, T from Evarcha).

Rhene aurata (L. Koch, 1879) -- see Simaethula

Rhene phoenicea (Simon, 1888) = Rhene rubrigera (Thorell, 1887) (Żabka, 1985: 444).

Gen. Rudakius Prószyński, 2016 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04362] Detail
type Menemerus cinctus O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885; gender masculine
In synonymy:
Rudakius admirandus (Logunov, 2007) = Rudakius ludhianaensis (Tikader, 1974) (Caleb, Prajapati & Ali, 2019: 417).
Rudakius citri (Sadana, 1980: 229, f. 1-5, mf, India, T from Phlegra) = Rudakius ludhianaensis (Tikader, 1974) (Nenilin, 1984b: 1178).
Rudakius endenae (Biswas & Biswas, 1992) = Rudakius ludhianaensis (Tikader, 1974) (Caleb, Prajapati & Ali, 2019: 417).
Rudakius incertus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885, T from Menemerus) = Rudakius cinctus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885) (Song, Zhu & Chen, 1999: 542).
Rudakius ludhianaensis (Sadana & Kaur, 1974, T from Marpissa) = Rudakius ludhianaensis (Tikader, 1974) (Brignoli, 1983c: 630, 642, sub Marpissa).
Rudakius rufovittatus (Spassky, 1952) = Rudakius cinctus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885) (Prószyński & Zochowska, 1981: 26, see also Nenilin, 1984a: 28; sub Pseudicius).
Rudakius vittatus (Simon, 1889) = Rudakius cinctus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1885) (Nenilin, 1984b: 1177, see also Prószyński, 1987: 49; sub Pseudicius).

Gen. Sandalodes Keyserling, 1883 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03208] Detail
N.B.: Considered a senior synonym of Karschiolina Brignoli, 1985: 380 (replacement name for Karschiola Strand, 1932, preoccupied in Lepidoptera/Arctiidae; replacement name for Ligurinus Karsch, 1878d: 27, type L. scopifer Karsch, 1878, preoccupied in Aves) by Żabka, 1991c: 51 (through transfer of type species); most species misplaced (Żabka, 2000: 695).
Transferred to other genera:
Sandalodes albociliatus Simon, 1900 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes calvus Simon, 1902 -- see Frigga
Sandalodes canosus Simon, 1900 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes cruciatus Simon, 1900 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes flavipes Berland, 1933 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes magnus Berland, 1933 -- see Plexippus
Sandalodes navatus Simon, 1900 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes nigrescens Berland, 1933 -- see Plexippus
Sandalodes nigrolineatus Berland, 1933 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes pubens Simon, 1900 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes rufescens Berland, 1934 -- see Habronattus
Sandalodes semicupreus (Simon, 1885) -- see Hyllus
Sandalodes seniculus Simon, 1900 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes triangulifer Berland, 1933 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes validus Simon, 1900 -- see Havaika
Sandalodes verecundus Simon, 1900 -- see Havaika
In synonymy:
Sandalodes albobarbatus (Keyserling, 1882) = Sandalodes scopifer (Karsch, 1878) (Żabka, 1991c: 52).
Sandalodes ludicrus (Keyserling, 1882, T from Bavia) = Sandalodes superbus (Karsch, 1878) (Żabka, 2000: 700, contra Żabka, 1991c: 52).
Sandalodes superciliosus (Bertkau, 1883, T from Philaeus) = Sandalodes superbus (Karsch, 1878) (Breitling et al., 2016b: 67).

Gen. Sarinda Peckham & Peckham, 1892 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03210] Detail
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Cineas Simon, 1901 by Galiano, 1965b: 271; not a senior synonym of Martella Peckham & Peckham, 1892 (Galiano, 1964b: 354).
Transferred to other genera:
Sarinda albiana Mello-Leitão, 1947 -- see Parafluda

type Scopocira dentichelis Simon, 1900; gender feminine

Gen. Siler Simon, 1889 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03225] Detail
type Siler cupreus Simon, 1889; gender masculine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Silerella Strand, 1906 by Prószyński, 1984a: 135 (by synonymy of type species), and 1985: 70; see Prószyński, 2002: 240, f. 81 for discussion of a female from Hawaii.
Transferred to other genera:
Siler elegans (Szombathy, 1915) -- see Udvardya
In synonymy:
Siler barbatus (Bösenberg & Strand, 1906, sub Silerella barbata) = Siler cupreus Simon, 1889 (Nishikawa, 1977b: 384, sub Silerella vittata).
Nomen dubium:
Siler vittatus (Karsch, 1879g: 87, j, Japan, as Marpissa vittata) -- Prószyński, 1973b: 119, 1984a: 135, 1985: 70: T from Marpissa.

Gen. Spartaeus Thorell, 1891 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03236] Detail
type Boethus spinimanus Thorell, 1878; gender masculine
N.B.: considered the earliest available name to replace Boethus Thorell, 1878, preoccupied, by Wanless, 1984a: 147.
Transferred to other genera:
Spartaeus ramipalpis (Thorell, 1892) -- see Mintonia
Spartaeus sexdentatus (Yaginuma, 1967) -- see Yaginumanis
In synonymy:
Spartaeus caligatus (Simon, 1900) = Spartaeus spinimanus (Thorell, 1878) (Wanless, 1984a: 148).
Spartaeus gracilis Thorell, 1891 = Spartaeus spinimanus (Thorell, 1878) (Wanless, 1984a: 148).
Spartaeus heterospineus Song & Chai, 1992 = Spartaeus platnicki Song, Chen & Gong, 1991 (Peng & Li, 2002b: 395).
Spartaeus striatipes (Simon, 1900) = Spartaeus spinimanus (Thorell, 1878) (Wanless, 1984a: 148).

Gen. Stagetillus Simon, 1885 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03238] Detail
N.B.: Considered a senior synonym of Padillothorax Simon, 1901 by Prószyński, 1987: 104 (by transfer of the type species Padillothorax semiostrinus Simon, 1901); Prószyński, 2017b: 26 revalidated Padillothorax, but not including P. semiostrinus, which was invalid; Prószyński, 2018b: 174 revalidated Padillothorax inclusively its type species.
Transferred to other genera:
Stagetillus elegans (Reimoser, 1927) -- see Padillothorus
Stagetillus semiostrinus (Simon, 1901) -- see Padillothorax
Stagetillus taprobanicus (Simon, 1902) -- see Padillothorax

Gen. Stenaelurillus Simon, 1886 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03239] Detail
type Stenaelurillus nigricaudus Simon, 1886; gender masculine
N.B.: Considered a senior synonym of Philotheroides Strand, 1934 by Prószyński, 1984a: 138 (by transfer of type species), of Mashonarus Wesołowska & Cumming, 2002 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03518] (type M. guttatus Wesołowska & Cumming, 2002) and of Microheros Wesołowska & Cumming, 1999 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03076] (type M. termitophagus Wesołowska & Cumming, 1999) by Logunov & Azarkina, 2018: 4.
Transferred to other genera:
Stenaelurillus ambiguus Denis, 1966 -- see Aelurillus
Stenaelurillus werneri Simon, 1906 -- see Evarcha
In synonymy:
Stenaelurillus cristatus Wesołowska & Russell-Smith, 2000 = Stenaelurillus hirsutus Lessert, 1927 (Wesołowska, 2014b: 602).
Stenaelurillus digitus Prajapati, Murthappa, Sankaran & Sebastian, 2016 = Stenaelurillus arambagensis (Biswas & Biswas, 1992) (Caleb et al., 2017b: 120).
Stenaelurillus hainanensis Peng, 1995 = Stenaelurillus minutus Song & Chai, 1991 (Wesołowska, 2014a: 251).
Stenaelurillus natalensis Haddad & Wesołowska, 2006 = Stenaelurillus guttiger (Simon, 1901) (Logunov & Azarkina, 2018: 47).
Stenaelurillus nigritarsis Simon, 1885 = Stenaelurillus nigricaudus Simon, 1886 (Szűts & Scharff, 2005: 372).
Stenaelurillus sahariensis (Berland & Millot, 1941) = Stenaelurillus nigricaudus Simon, 1886 (Logunov & Azarkina, 2018: 84).
Nomina dubia:
Stenaelurillus giovae Caporiacco, 1936b: 79 (j, Libya) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:036328] -- Wesołowska, 2014b: 620.
Stenaelurillus setosus (Thorell, 1895: 381, originally in Philotherus, given generic replacement name Philotheroides setosus by Strand, 1934: 275, placed here by Prószyński, 1984a: 138 (j, Myanmar) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:036339] -- Wesołowska, 2014a: 252, erroneously called a nomen nudum.

Gen. Synagelides Strand, 1906 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03247] Detail
type Synagelides agoriformis Strand, 1906; gender masculine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Tagoria Schenkel, 1963: 393, type T. cavaleriei Schenkel, 1963 by Bohdanowicz, 1979: 53; for notes on males from India and Nepal, see Prószyński, 1992b: 206, f. 175-181.
In synonymy:
Synagelides dhaulagiricus Bohdanowicz, 1987 = Synagelides martensi Bohdanowicz, 1987 (Logunov & Hereward, 2006: 287).
Synagelides gorapanicus Bohdanowicz, 1987 = Synagelides oleksiaki Bohdanowicz, 1987 (Logunov & Hereward, 2006: 289).
Synagelides himalaicus Bohdanowicz, 1987 = Synagelides martensi Bohdanowicz, 1987 (Logunov & Hereward, 2006: 287).
Synagelides jiricus Bohdanowicz, 1987 = Synagelides martensi Bohdanowicz, 1987 (Logunov & Hereward, 2006: 287).
Synagelides thodungus Bohdanowicz, 1987 = Synagelides martensi Bohdanowicz, 1987 (Logunov & Hereward, 2006: 287).
Synagelides wyszynskii Bohdanowicz, 1987 = Synagelides martensi Bohdanowicz, 1987 (Logunov & Hereward, 2006: 287).

Gen. Synemosyna Hentz, 1846 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03248] Detail
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Simonella Peckham & Peckham, 1885 by Galiano, 1966a: 341.
Transferred to other genera:
Synemosyna formosana (Saito, 1933) -- see Myrmarachne
Synemosyna pumilio Karsch, 1880 -- see Myrmarachne
Synemosyna transversa Mukerjee, 1930 -- see Myrmarachne
In synonymy:
Synemosyna atrogaster (Mello-Leitão, 1941) = Synemosyna lauretta Peckham & Peckham, 1892 (Galiano, 1966a: 362).
Synemosyna bicolor (Peckham & Peckham, 1892) = Synemosyna americana (Peckham & Peckham, 1885) (Cutler, 1981a: 343).
Synemosyna claustrorum (Mello-Leitão, 1933) = Synemosyna aurantiaca (Mello-Leitão, 1917) (Galiano, 1966a: 348).
Synemosyna mastigostyla (Mello-Leitão, 1917) = Synemosyna aurantiaca (Mello-Leitão, 1917) (Galiano, 1966a: 348).
Synemosyna melanura Mello-Leitão, 1917 = Synemosyna lauretta Peckham & Peckham, 1892 (Galiano, 1966a: 362).
Synemosyna peckhami (Mello-Leitão, 1933) = Synemosyna myrmeciaeformis (Taczanowski, 1871) (Galiano, 1966a: 367).
Synemosyna simplex (Chamberlin, 1925) = Synemosyna decipiens (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1896) (Galiano, 1966a: 355).
Synemosyna ypsilon (Piza, 1937) = Synemosyna aurantiaca (Mello-Leitão, 1917) (Galiano, 1966a: 349).
Nomina dubia:
Synemosyna bimaculata (Mello-Leitão, 1917c: 139, 1933a: 58, pl. 1, f. 3, f, Brazil, originally in Simonella) -- Galiano, 1966a: 354.
Synemosyna fasciata Mello-Leitão, 1922a: 222 (f, Brazil) -- Galiano, 1966a: 357.
Synemosyna fissidentata (Szombathy, 1913: 34, 57, f. 10-11, f, Paraguay, originally in Simonella) -- Galiano, 1966a: 357.
Synemosyna lunata (Walckenaer, 1837: 387, m, USA, originally in Myrmecium) -- Galiano, 1966a: 360.
Synemosyna magniscuti Mello-Leitão, 1939h: 292, f. 13-14 (m, Brazil) -- Galiano, 1966a: 367.
Synemosyna rubra (Walckenaer, 1837: 387, mf, USA, originally in Myrmecium) -- Galiano, 1966a: 360.
Synemosyna subtilis (Taczanowski, 1871: 122, f, Guyana, originally in Janus, placed here by Mello-Leitão, 1933a: 48) -- Galiano, 1966a: 376.

Gen. Thiania C. L. Koch, 1846 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03268] Detail
type Thiania pulcherrima C. L. Koch, 1846; gender feminine
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Nicylla Thorell, 1890, of Pselcis Simon, 1903: 825, type Euophrys latefasciata Simon, 1877 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03096], and of Thianitara Simon, 1903 by Zhang & Maddison, 2015: 32, synonymy of Nicylla and Thianitara rejected by Prószyński, 2017b: 77.
Transferred to other genera:
Thiania spectrum (Simon, 1903) -- see Thianitara
Thiania sundevalli (Thorell, 1890) -- see Nicylla
Thiania thailandica (Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2012) -- see Thianitara
In synonymy:
Thiania chiriatapuensis (Tikader, 1977, T from Euophrys) = Thiania bhamoensis Thorell, 1887 (Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2010: 182, sub E. chiariatapuensis, lapsus).
Thiania oppressa (Thorell, 1892) = Thiania bhamoensis Thorell, 1887 (Żabka, 1985: 452).
Nomen nudum:
Thiania viridimicans Simon, 1901 - Prószyński, 1984a: 146 (m, India).

Gen. Thyene Simon, 1885 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03273] Detail
type Attus imperialis Rossi, 1846; gender feminine
N.B.: replacement name for Thya Simon, 1876a: 51, preoccupied in Trichoptera by Curtis, 1834; considered a junior synonym of Mithion Simon, 1884 by Prószyński, 1987: 111, 156 (by transfer of type species, but given precedence over Mithion Simon, 1884 by ICZN, 1991b, see also Prószyński, 1989d) and a senior synonym of Gangus Simon, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02961] by Prószyński & Deeleman-Reinhold, 2010: 184 and of Paramodunda Lessert, 1925 by Prószyński, 1990: 252; for comments on the limits of this genus, see Prószyński, 1992b: 207, f. 183-184.
Transferred to other genera:
Thyene canestrinii (Ninni, 1868) -- see Mendoza
Thyene carlini (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) -- see Menemerus
Thyene damarensis Lawrence, 1927 -- see Hyllus
Thyene grassei (Berland & Millot, 1941) -- see Pseudicius
Thyene gridellii (Caporiacco, 1934) -- see Mendoza
Thyene hotingchiehi (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Mendoza
Thyene memorabilis (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1876) -- see Mendoza
Thyene pichoni (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Mendoza
Thyene sexmaculatus (C. L. Koch, 1846) -- see Opisthoncus
Thyene tschekiangensis (Schenkel, 1963) -- see Mendoza
In synonymy:
Thyene bilineata striatipes Lawrence, 1927 = Thyene bilineata Lawrence, 1927 (Azarkina & Foord, 2013: 176).
Thyene coccineovittata crudelis (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) = Thyene coccineovittata (Simon, 1886) (Wesołowska & Haddad, 2009: 83).
Thyene lindbergi Roewer, 1962 = Thyene imperialis (Rossi, 1846) (Logunov & Zamanpoore, 2005: 231).
Thyene lupula (Simon, 1902, T from Viciria) = Thyene ocellata (Thorell, 1899) (Clark, 1974: 24, sub Viciria).
Thyene magdalenae Lessert, 1927 = Thyene australis Peckham & Peckham, 1903 (Wesołowska & Cumming, 2008: 214).
Thyene moreletii (Lucas, 1846) = Thyene imperialis (Rossi, 1846) (Denis, 1947a: 79).
Thyene pulchra Peckham & Peckham, 1903 = Thyene coccineovittata (Simon, 1886) (Mariante & Hill, 2019: 1).
Thyene sinensis Schenkel, 1963 = Thyene imperialis (Rossi, 1846) (Wesołowska, 1981b: 159).
Thyene strandi Caporiacco, 1939 = Thyene natalii Peckham & Peckham, 1903 (Wesołowska & Haddad, 2009: 85).
Thyene viciriaeformis (Berland & Millot, 1941, T from Brancus) = Thyene ocellata (Thorell, 1899) (Clark, 1974: 24, sub Viciria).
Nomen dubium:
Thyene scalarinota Strand, 1907a: 547, Strand, 1907n: 723 (f, South Africa, originally T. scalarinotum) [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:036614] -- Nentwig et al., 2020: 26.
Nomen nudum:
Thyene indica Prószyński, 1992b: 241.

Gen. Thyenillus Simon, 1909 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03274] Detail
type Thyenillus fernandensis Simon, 1910; gender masculine
Thyenillus fernandensis Simon, 1909 * | m | Equatorial Guinea (Bioko)     [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidersp:036628]
Thyenillus fernandensis Simon, 1909f: 430 (Dm).
Gen. Thyenula Simon, 1902 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03275] Detail
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Tularosa Peckham & Peckham, 1903 by Wesolowska, 1993b: 33 and of Klamathia Peckham & Peckham, 1903 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03015] (Wesolowska, 2012b: 337, after Prószyński, 1987: 61).
Transferred to other genera:
Thyenula laxa Zhang & Maddison, 2012 -- see Rumburak
Thyenula nelshoogte Zhang & Maddison, 2012 -- see Rumburak
Thyenula plumosa (Lessert, 1925) -- see Cembalea
In synonymy:
Thyenula flava (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) = Thyenula juvenca Simon, 1902 (Wesołowska, 2012b: 337).
Thyenula hortensis Wesołowska & Cumming, 2008 = Thyenula munda (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) (Wesołowska, Azarkina & Russell-Smith, 2014: 58).
Thyenula ogdeni (Peckham & Peckham, 1903) = Thyenula aurantiaca (Simon, 1902) (Clark, 1974: 17, sub Tularosa).

Thyenula alotama Wesołowska, Azarkina & Russell-Smith, 2014: 47, f. 170-175 (Dmf).

Thyenula ammonis Denis, 1947a: 81, pl. 6, f. 12-13 (Dm).

Gen. Titanattus Peckham & Peckham, 1885 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03276] Detail
type Titanattus saevus Peckham & Peckham, 1885; gender masculine
N.B.: synonymy of Agelista Simon, 1900 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:02800] (type Agelista andina Simon, 1900) considered by Bustamante & Ruiz, 2017: 335.
In synonymy:
Titanattus hirsutus (Mello-Leitão, 1941) = Titanattus andinus (Simon, 1900) (Galiano, 1963d: 29, sub Agelista hirsuta).
Titanattus obscurus (Mello-Leitão, 1943, T from Scopocira) = Titanattus andinus (Simon, 1900) (Galiano, 1963d: 29, sub Agelista obscura).
Titanattus schubarti (Soares & Camargo, 1948) = Titanattus andinus (Simon, 1900) (Galiano, 1963d: 29, sub Agelista schubarti).
Nomen dubium:
Titanattus juduliani Simon, 1900b: 382 (f, Argentina) -- Galiano, 1963a: 460.
Nomen nudum:
Titanattus modestus (Simon, 1901a: 436, sub Agelista modesta) -- (= T. andinus per Galiano, 1963a: 285, sub Agelista).

Gen. Tomis F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:04596] Detail
type Tomis palpalis F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901; gender masculine
N.B.: considered a synonym of Sitticus Simon, 1901 by Galiano, 1991a: 61, revalidated and synonymy of Pseudattulus Caporiacco, 1947 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03179] (type species Pseudattulus kratochvili Caporiacco, 1947) by Maddison et al., 2020: 35.
In synonymy:
Tomis cabellensis (Prószyński, 1971, T from Sitticus) = Tomis kratochvili (Caporiacco, 1947) (Ruiz & Brescovit, 2005b: 756, sub Pseudattulus incertus, confirmed by W. Maddison in Maddison et al., 2020: 36).
Tomis incertus Caporiacco, 1955 = Tomis kratochvili (Caporiacco, 1947) (Ruiz, Brescovit & Lise, 2007: 377).
Tomis jonesae (Bryant, 1948) = Tomis palpalis F. O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1901 (Galiano, 1991a: 61, sub Sitticus).

In synonymy:
Yllenus baltistanus shaksgamica Caporiacco, 1935 = Yllenus baltistanus Caporiacco, 1935 (Prószyński, 1968d: 445).
Yllenus staregai Punda, 1975 = Yllenus kulczynskii Punda, 1975 (Logunov, 1992c: 67).
Nomen dubium:
Yllenus brueggeri Lebert, 1877: 100, 313, f. 48-49 (f, Switzerland) -- Lessert, 1910b: 600, see also Logunov & Marusik, 2003a: 157, f. 504.

type Zenodorus durvillei (Walckenaer, 1837)
N.B.: considered a junior synonym of Omoedus Thorell, 1881 by Zhang & Maddison, 2012b: 21, rejected by Prószyński, 2017b: 76; Zenodorus itself considered a senior synonym of Mollika Peckham & Peckham, 1901a: 303 (type Philaeus metallescens L. Koch, 1879) by Żabka, 1988: 423, 478 (Mollica is an unjustified emendation).

Gen. Zygoballus Peckham & Peckham, 1885 [urn:lsid:nmbe.ch:spidergen:03314] Detail
N.B.: considered a senior synonym of Amerotritte Mello-Leitão, 1944 by Galiano, 1980b: 34; not a senior synonym of Messua Peckham & Peckham, 1896 (Maddison, 1996: 233).
Transferred to other genera:
Zygoballus citri Sadana, 1991 -- see Rhene
Zygoballus desidiosus (Peckham & Peckham, 1896) -- see Messua
Zygoballus narmadaensis Tikader, 1975 -- see Bianor
Zygoballus pashanensis Tikader, 1975 -- see Bianor
In synonymy:
Zygoballus bettini Peckham & Peckham, 1888 = Zygoballus rufipes Peckham & Peckham, 1885 (Edwards, 1980: 12).
Homonym replaced:
Zygoballus sexpunctatus (Mello-Leitão, 1945) -- see Zygoballus melloleitaoi
Nomen dubium:
